title: How to Dispute Surprise Medical Bills
description: In October, I received a doctors bill for $21,500 for treatment my daughter received in the emergency room of a local hospital after suffering a one-inch cut on her forehead. I remember opening the bill while walking down my driveway and nearly having a heart attack: How could 10 measly stitches possibly cost more than 20 grand? And why were we being billed for services wed received at a hospital that was in our insurance companys network?

title: One Dead and 22 Have Been Hospitalized in Listeria Outbreak Tied to Florida
description: One person has died and 22 people have been hospitalized in a listeria outbreak, with most of the infected people having been in Florida about a month before they became sick, the federal authorities said Thursday.

title: California Wildfire Burns More Than 900 Acres and Prompts Evacuations
description: A fast-growing fire near South Yuba River State Park in Nevada County, Calif., about 70 miles northeast of Sacramento, has grown to more than 900 acres in two days, prompting evacuation orders for hundreds of residents of nearby communities, the authorities said Thursday.

title: Columbia Wont Participate in the Next U.S. News Rankings
description: Columbia University will not participate in the next U.S. News & World Report rankings of colleges across the country, after a Columbia math professor questioned the accuracy of the data that secured its No. 2 spot in the influential rankings, the university announced on Thursday night.

title: Nine People Are Injured in Newark Shooting, Officials Say
description: NEWARK  Nine people were hospitalized after being shot Thursday evening in Newark, the authorities said.

title: Wearing a Piece of History: Vintage Clothing Stores Find a Growing Market
description: Until recently, I had never realized how drab my wardrobe is. I do a bit of acting in my spare time and was booked for a project that required me to source my own outfit. I didnt think too much about the request  low-budget films often ask actors to wear what they have  but the instruction to find something bright, colorful and unbranded was proving difficult.

title: Former Apple Lawyer Pleads Guilty to Insider Trading
description: A former senior lawyer at Apple who enforced its insider-trading policies pleaded guilty on Thursday to perpetrating an insider-trading scheme, which prosecutors said had involved making stock transactions before the company announced it fell short of iPhone sales expectations.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC  This puzzle solves to a passage from a particularly wonderful book, Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge and the Teachings of Plants. The author, Robin Wall Kimmerer, is a botanist and a member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation, and her descriptions of flora and fauna are marvelous.

title: Tag Line
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Welcome to Friday, everyone. We made it, and weve got a themeless gem of a puzzle to start off the weekend. Todays puzzle is a collaboration between the constructors Christina Iverson (new assistant editor of the Los Angeles Times Crossword) and Caitlin Reid (mainstay on The New Yorkers all-star crossword-constructor roster).

title: Missile Strikes on Ukraine Kill at Least 21 Near Odesa
description: At least 21 people were killed and dozens were injured when Russian missiles struck a residential tower and a recreational center in a coastal town southwest of the Black Sea port of Odesa early Friday, Ukrainian officials said.

title: Falling Fast, Then Fiancs for Seven Years
description: Late on a September evening in 2010, as Luke Neville Kalat was preparing to head home from a dance party at Bowlmor Lanes near Manhattans Union Square, he noticed a man staring at him from across the room. That man was Justin Claude Conner.

title: Through an Old-School Setup, a Matchmaker Meets Her Sinatra
description: Erin Courtney Bellsey has always loved playing matchmaker. By her count, she has paired dozens of couples, two of which are now engaged.

title: While Following Grateful Dead Tribute Bands, a Romantic Turn
description: Caroline Cornell and Daniel Patrick Logan werent technically off the grid when they found romance on the Lost Coast of Northern California, the states most remote oceanfront area, in the summer of 2014. But the routes each had taken to get there could definitely be described as off the beaten path.

title: Growing Closer One (Very) Late Dinner at a Time
description: Alaina Korinne Collura had just transferred to a new department at the public accounting firm Ernst & Young in New York when she was put on a project with Joseph Vincent Durkin, in March 2015.

title: A Bet She Couldnt Resist
description: Why arent you eating? my mother said to me, her Yonkers accent blaring into the otherwise hushed Chinese restaurant. A 77-year-old Italian-American hairdresser who believed that almost all problems could be solved with a pile of spaghetti and meatballs, she viewed my lack of appetite as a warning flare.

title: On Their First Date, Plunging Into a Relationship
description: For their first date, Stephanie Schulter and Halle Anne Bauer jumped into the Atlantic together in 17-degree weather.

title: Finding Love From Studio 1A in Rockefeller Plaza
description: Around Valentines Day last year, Jenna Bush Hager, a host of NBCs Today with Hoda & Jenna, embarked on a mission: to help her friend and colleague Elizabeth Harrington Leist, who goes by Libby, find romance.

title: Russia Hints at Linking Griners Case to Fate of Merchant of Death
description: WASHINGTON  She is an American professional basketball star, accused of carrying hashish oil in her luggage.

title: Long Live the Theater: Mariupols Drama Company to Perform Again
description: UZHHOROD, Ukraine  Dressed in black, the actors moved around a sparse rehearsal room preparing a new play  the story of a dissident Ukrainian who died in a Russian prison camp decades ago. As they took a break, they gathered in a circle with their arms around each other, laughing and chattering.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: The U.S. Supreme Court limited the Environmental Protection Agencys powers to restrict carbon emissions from power plants.

title: Profiles in Courage
description: I was speaking to a gymnasium full of American middle schoolers once about a book Id written on the Holocaust when a boy raised his hand and asked, Was everybody from Nazi evil? Id been discussing the Holocaust for 45 minutes and the whole time hed heard Nazi Germany as Nazi, Germany, as though I were saying a place name like Atlanta, Georgia.

title: Quotation of the Day: Israel Parliament Collapse Sets Up 5th Election in 4 Years
description: I have no energy to vote again. I feel I am being forced to vote. I feel I am being held hostage by small and foul-smelling politics.

title: Corrections: July 1, 2022
description: An article on Wednesday about Turkeys decision not to Bar Sweden and Finland from NATO referred incorrectly to Finland. It is a Nordic not a Scandinavian country.

title: Stephen Colbert Reflects on This Year in the Supreme Court
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: North Korea Suggests Alien Things From the South Brought Covid
description: SEOUL  North Korea suggested on Friday that the coronavirus had entered the country on foreign objects from South Korea, saying that its first reported outbreak had begun in villages near the countries border after people there touched alien things.

title: Climate Protesters in Australia Face Harsh New Penalties
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  When climate protesters took to the streets of Sydney this week, including blocking one of its busiest traffic tunnels for over an hour, they faced the fury of government officials who labeled them professional pests and warned that theyd see the book being thrown at them.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: FRIDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: End of a Pandemic Tracker Signifies a New Phase in Travel
description: Hours before President Donald J. Trump blocked nonessential travel from Europe on March 11, 2020, in response to the spiraling coronavirus pandemic, The New York Timess deputy Travel editor, Elisabeth Goodridge, flew to her home in New York from Brussels, where she had been vacationing with her family. Countries started shutting down, Ms. Goodridge remembered.

title: The N.Y.P.D.s Sex-Crimes Division Faces an Investigation
description: Good morning. Its Friday. Well look at a Justice Department civil rights investigation that will examine the Police Departments Special Victims Division. Well also get the latest on upgrading Pennsylvania Station.

title: Pictures of Brittney Griner in custody offer few clues to her well-being.
description: Photos of the W.N.B.A. star Brittney Griner being led through a courthouse outside Moscow were released this week before her trial on drug charges that is set to begin on Friday, giving the Western world a rare glimpse of her after four months of being detained in Russia.

title: The New York Times News Quiz, July 1, 2022
description: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
description: A selection of entertainment highlights this weekend, including "Hamlet" at the Park Avenue Armory in Manhattan.

title: The Single Best Guide Ive Heard to the Supreme Courts Rightward Shift
description: In the past few weeks alone, the Supreme Court has delivered a firestorm of conservative legal victories. States now have far less leeway to restrict gun permits. The right to abortion is no longer constitutionally protected. The Environmental Protection Agency has been kneecapped in its ability to regulate carbon emissions, and by extension, all executive branch agencies will see their power significantly diminished.

title: The Supreme Courts E.P.A. Decision Is More Gloom Than Doom
description: Many of the headlines about the Supreme Courts 6-to-3 ruling on West Virginia v. Environmental Protection Agency on Thursday have suggested an existential setback: a major blow to American decarbonization and global climate ambition. But the effect is less like a nail in the coffin and more like putting an additional set of brakes on an already stalled project. For the time being, at least, the decision functions chiefly to cement the status quo.

title: Beer Runs, Porcupine Hunts, Jars of Teeth and Much More
description: If you had to trace a line through your history, connect your past to your present, what shape would it take? In Morgan Taltys debut collection, Night of the Living Rez, it forms something like a circle, one that snakes through the past but always ends up in the present, in the madness and joy of today.

title: Strange Histories: Four New Novels Weave Past and Present
description: Initially, Abbigail Nguyen Rosewoods CONSTELLATIONS OF EVE (Texas Tech University, 211 pp., $29.95) looks as if its going to be a straightforward chronicle of the bad decisions of beautiful people  a romance whose initial meet-cute contains the seeds of its ultimate failure, a female friendship whose intense closeness is linked to its acute toxicity.

title: Americas Post-Roe Chaos Is Here
description: Its chaos out there.

title: What Makes a Fetus a Person?
description: Dobbs v. Jackson Womens Health Organization has returned the issue of abortion to legislatures. There, pro-lifers will work to ensure that unborn children in every jurisdiction are protected by law. Though individual states can (and already have) sought to protect the most vulnerable human beings through ordinary legislation, constitutional protection of unborn children as equal persons under the law remains the movements ultimate  if elusive  goal.

title: A Supreme Court Head-Scratcher: Is a Colonial Musket Analogous to an AR-15?
description: Justice Clarence Thomass majority opinion last Thursday expanding gun rights chisels into constitutional law a questionable and judge-empowering form of historical reasoning intelligible only to a very small number of legal elites. The result will most likely be a Second Amendment jurisprudence increasingly out of step with public opinion, and court decisions ever more inscrutable to the hundreds of millions of people whose lives they affect.

title: Understanding the Summer Air Travel Mess
description: More people flew out of airports in the United States on Sunday  2.46 million according to the Transportation Security Administration  than on any other day so far this year.  The Fourth of July holiday is expected to be even busier, with Hopper, a travel booking app, predicting that nearly 13 million passengers will fly to, from and within the United States this weekend.

title: As Federal Climate-Fighting Tools Are Taken Away, Cities and States Step Up
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Democrats Need Patriotism Now More Than Ever
description: Fourth of July fireworks echo eerily in a divided country. In theory, this patriotic holiday marks what holds us together, beyond all our disagreement. In practice it amplifies American division. The year that Independence Day memorializes, 1776, also lends its name to the Trumpist 1776 Project, a riposte to the 1619 Project. The very idea of patriotism risks becoming a partisan marker: In 2019, fully 76 percent of Republicans and only 22 percent of Democrats said they were extremely proud to be American, according to Gallup.

title: The Supreme Court Is the Final Word on Nothing
description: The U.S. Constitution contains several idle provisions: words, phrases and clauses that have little to no bearing on our constitutional order as it currently exists.

title: So Stressed Out: Gas Prices Force Many to Rethink Driving, and Spending
description: KATY, Texas  Most Americans would gladly pay the $4.29 for a gallon of regular gas Buc-ees was charging this week on Interstate 10 between Houston and San Antonio, more than 50 cents below the national average.

title: They Uncover New Fossils, but They Also Bite
description: A small group of paleontologists recently discovered 10 species of ancient mammals previously unknown to science. But they had an enormous number of helpers at their dig site: thousands of tiny ants.

title: Why Judges Keep Recusing Themselves From a N.Y.C. Vaccine Mandate Case
description: Its a routine step when someone files a lawsuit in federal court in Manhattan: The case is randomly assigned to a judge.

title: Israels New Prime Minister, Yair Lapid, Played the Long Game to Power
description: JERUSALEM  Nearly a decade ago Yair Lapid, then the new leader of Israels political center, was asked by a television interviewer if he envisaged becoming prime minister after the next election.

title: A Memorial for the Titanic Gone Dark
description: Funds are scarce for the restoration of the Titanic Memorial Lighthouse.

title: Neglected Titanic Memorial: Like Their Graves Have Not Been Tended
description: On a landlocked street corner at the entrance to the South Street Seaport stands a shabby, rust-streaked old lighthouse, its lantern dark, dwarfed by modern towers to its south and west. Passed with scarcely a glance by most people heading to the shops and bars on Fulton Street, this is the 109-year-old Titanic Memorial Lighthouse, which once presided over the East River waterfront from a far prouder height, shining its fixed green beacon miles out to Sandy Hook, at the southern entrance of Lower New York Bay.

title: Mango Man Is the Fruits Foremost Poet, Philosopher, Fan and Scientist
description: MALIHABAD, India  Theirs is a friendship of over half a century, the old man and his mango tree.

title: Is Baltimore Big Enough for the Two of Them?
description: BALTIMORE  Local news wars have largely gone the way of the phone booth as newspapers have shriveled and reporter jobs have been cut. But one is taking shape in Baltimore, bringing a new kind of rivalry.

title: Workers at Airports Have Had It
description: PARIS  For 18 years, Marie Marivel has worked as a security agent at Charles de Gaulle Airport in Paris, screening throngs of passengers and thousands of bags each day. It has always been a taxing job, she says, but conditions have lately made it downright impossible, as staffing shortages nearly double her workload and a cost-of-living crisis plunders her modest paycheck.

title: When Private Jets Ferry Billionaires to Small-Town Idaho
description: HAILEY, Idaho  Robert Kraft, the owner of the New England Patriots, flies in a Gulfstream G650. So do Jeff Bezos and Dan Schulman, PayPals chief executive. The jets, roughly 470 of which are in operation, retail for about $75 million each.

title: Who Will Help Care for Texas Post-Roe Babies?
description: ARGYLE, Texas  Two days after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, a 27-year-old woman delivered her fourth child, a boy she named Cason. Born after his mother fled from domestic abuse and was denied an abortion, he is among the first of many post-Roe babies expected in Texas.

title: Griners supporters are imploring the Biden administration to secure her release.
description: Brittney Griners family and supporters are increasingly imploring President Biden and the U.S. government to secure her release amid continuing fears that she could be used by Russia in the geopolitical jousting over its war in Ukraine.

title: Xi Tells a Muted Hong Kong That Political Power Is for Patriots
description: HONG KONG  Under swarms of security, beneath clouds threatening rain, Chinas leader, Xi Jinping, marked the 25th anniversary of Hong Kongs return to China with a showcase of just how thoroughly he had transformed and subdued this once-freewheeling city.

title: An Abortion Rights Champion of the 1970s on Life Before and After Roe
description: A little over 50 years ago, Nancy Stearns, a young lawyer, was presenting a case in New York with a bold legal assertion: that the right to abortion was fundamental to equal rights for women.

title: Landslide in India Buries Dozens, Killing at Least 25
description: At least 25 people were killed and more feared dead, after days of heavy rainfall set off a landslide in Indias remote and mountainous northeastern state of Manipur.

title: The Court vs. the Climate
description: The Supreme Court has made it harder for the country to fight the ravages of climate change.

title: Eurozone inflation rises to 8.6 percent, the highest ever, driven by energy prices.
description: Record energy prices drove the inflation rate for the countries using the common European currency to 8.6 percent over the year through June, as the fallout of the war in Ukraine and the economic conflict it has set off between Russia and Western Europe continued to bite.

title: Putin moves to seize a large gas venture in Russias Far East.
description: Russia is moving to take over an important natural gas joint venture, putting the investments of Shell and two Japanese energy trading companies at risk in a seizure of a significant foreign investment.

title: A Blow to Regulators
description: The Supreme Court yesterday limited the Environmental Protection Agencys authority to regulate power plant emissions, dealing a significant blow to the Biden administrations climate change agenda. The ruling is the product of a longstanding campaign by some conservatives to curtail or dismantle the power of the so-called administrative state, the system of agencies that regulate wide areas of the economy. It is already altering the balance of power between businesses and the regulators that oversee them.

title: The Princess Review: Holding His Heart in Her Hands
description: Le-Van Kiets fantasy The Princess opens in a traditional manner, with the trill of Celtic-inspired flutes, a pink sunrise and a slow climb to the top of a spindly tower, where an unnamed princess-bride-to-be (Joey King) lies on a bed strewn with rose petals. But here, the royal beauty feigns sleep. Five minutes into this slender yet vigorous blood-spattered fable, two enemy guards enter to drag our heroine to the chapel  and she brutally kills them. Clearly, the classic genre that galvanizes Kiet and the screenwriters Ben Lustig and Jake Thornton doesnt hark back to ye olde European fairy tales but rather to the feminist revenge thrillers of the 1970s: works of exploitation and wuxia cinema where warrior women stuck it to the man. With knives.

title: Pay Down Your Credit Card Balances, and Other Tips for a Slowing Economy
description: With interest rates rising along with worries about an economic slowdown, now is a good time to pay down credit card balances and bolster emergency savings, financial experts say.

title: Summer Reading Contest, Week 4: What Got Your Attention in The Times This Week?
description: Welcome to Week Four of our 13th Annual Summer Reading Contest.

title: Gray walls, books and a Lenin monument: A look inside the lockup where Griner has been held.
description: The detention facility just outside Moscow where Brittney Griner, the American basketball star, has been held is a former orphanage rebuilt a decade ago to house women jailed before trial and, separately, women serving their prison sentences.

title: The Kremlin rejects the suggestion that Griners case is politically motivated.
description: As the U.S. basketball star Brittney Griner appeared in a Russian court, the Kremlin denied on Friday that the drug charges against her were politically motivated.

title: A Beloved Black-Run Bookstore in Los Angeles Is Closing
description: LOS ANGELES When James Fugate and Tom Hamilton started Eso Won Books in 1988, their books, almost all by Black authors, were stacked in dozens of crates; some in Fugates apartment, the rest in Hamiltons garage.

title: Chip Shortage Puts a Big Dent in U.S. Auto Sales
description: The auto industry is facing worrying signs all across its horizon, including rising interest rates and fears of a recession.

title: After Rocketman, Taron Egerton Transforms Again for Black Bird
description: Taron Egerton channeled a pop god in the Elton John biopic Rocketman, winning raves  and a Golden Globe  for his portrayal of how a shy piano prodigy blossomed into an international superstar.

title: Winners of Our Fifth Annual Podcast Contest
description: Exploding Facts: How to Convince Your Parents to Let You Get a Pet, by Mia Tweel, 12, is one of 10 winning entries from this years podcast contest.

title: TikTok tells Republican senators how it plans to keep American data away from China.
description: TikTok gave U.S. lawmakers more details in a letter dated Thursday about how it plans to keep data about its American users separate from ByteDance, its Chinese parent company, aiming to combat concerns that the video app poses a national security risk.

title: How TikTok Became a Best-Seller Machine
description: Many of this years best-selling books have something in common, but its not any of the usual factors: a famous or long-established author, a tie-in with a movie or TV show.

title: Are We Still Monogamous? And 6 Other Questions to Ask Your Partner.
description: The past two-plus years have been universally tumultuous, and couples therapists say they have been dealing with the fallout in their practices every day.

title: Hurricane Bonnie Swirls Off the West Coast of Mexico. It Poses No Threat to Land.
description: Bonnie briefly became the first major hurricane of the Pacific hurricane season on Tuesday after tearing across Central America as a tropical storm over the weekend, bringing heavy rain and causing several deaths.

title: Womens Euros Offer a Summer Free-for-All
description: That old, familiar feeling crackled and fizzed into the warm night air as 20,000 fans streamed out of Elland Road last Friday. England had just dismantled the reigning European champion. A major tournament, on home turf, was only a few days away. The weeks ahead seemed to glisten with promise.

title: The Best Films of 2022, So Far
description: A little over halfway through 2022, the year in movies has already been intriguing, with one of the best-reviewed releases so far topping the box office. That would be Top Gun: Maverick. But if youve already seen it and want to catch up on other strong films, I asked The Timess co-chief critics, A.O. Scott and Manohla Dargis, for their favorites. Here they are, in no particular order.  Stephanie Goodman

title: A Chameleon Flies From The Blacklist to The Kite Runner
description: An early scene in the new Broadway play The Kite Runner is mostly spoken in Dari, the Afghan dialect of Farsi, though the action depicts a distinctly American art form.

title: The Real Only Murders Building, and More: The Week in Narrated Articles
description: This weekend, listen to a collection of narrated articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.

title: New Zealand Designates Proud Boys a Terrorist Group
description: New Zealand has declared the Proud Boys, the far-right American group that played a key role in the deadly storming of the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, to be a terrorist organization, making it illegal for New Zealanders to participate in or support its activities.

title: Heres your Fourth of July forecast, America.
description: Hot dogs. Apple pie. Sweat stains.

title: Elvis | Anatomy of a Scene
description: Baz Luhrmann narrates a sequence from his biopic starring Austin Butler and Tom Hanks.

title: Watch Austin Butler Cause Hysteria in Elvis
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, we ask directors to reveal the secrets that go into making key scenes in their movies. See new episodes in the series on Fridays. You can also watch our collection of more than 150 videos on YouTube and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

title: Labeled a Challenge by NATO, China Signals Its Own Hard-Line Worldview
description: When NATO put forward a new blueprint for the future this week, the alliance did not mince words on China.

title: Whats in Our Queue? Beyonc and More
description: Im the reporting fellow on The Timess Culture desk. Here are five things I've been watching and listening to.

title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
description: Cdric Klapischs unconventional meet-cute drama dwells entirely in what happens before rather than after the fateful meeting of two would-be lovers. The film opens with a shot of a man and woman seated next to each other on a train in Paris. We soon realize that these are our protagonists  Rmy (Franois Civil), a factory worker, and Mlanie (Ana Girardot), a lab researcher  but that theyre strangers to one another. They live in adjacent buildings, frequent the same supermarket and visit the same pharmacy to seek medication for opposing ailments: Rmy cant sleep; Mlanie sleeps too much.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. These are fractious times, and I imagine well register the charged atmosphere over this weekend, the 246th anniversary of our declaration of independence from Britain and the start of our experiment in democracy. I hope youll hold your family and friends close. I hope youll cook for them the best you can. Fellowship ought to be something we all agree is important, however and whatever we cook.

title: Circling the Bases as Baseball Nears Its Midpoint
description: The All-Star break has typically been used to split up baseballs first and second halves. While that has always been misleading  teams often play around 90 games in the first half, leaving only 72 for the second half  it is even more extreme this season as the All-Star Game wont be held until July 19, the latest it has been played in a full season since 1977.

title: This $20 Device Turns a Handgun Into an Automatic Weapon
The Fourth of July weekend will test airlines struggling to bounce back.
description: Delays and cancellations have plagued air travel, and the Fourth of July weekend may be the biggest test yet for the airline industry, which has faced scrutiny from customers, regulators and investors.

title: LIV Golfers Attract Fans and Outrage at Pumpkin Ridge
description: NORTH PLAINS, Ore.  Even as Phil Mickelson and other marquee players teed off to applause on Thursday in a Saudi government-backed tournament outside Portland, the golfers were excoriated in a protest and an affiliated television ad by family members and survivors of the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.

title: The Greatest Grilled Corn Is Glazed
description: When cooking fresh sweet corn for one, nothing beats the microwave: A single ear, in its husk, goes in at full power for three minutes. The husk traps steam, giving the kernels such an intense corn flavor and juiciness that butter becomes nearly superfluous (nearly). But for a crowd? You have more options.

title: Cardi Bs All-Star Team-Up, and 9 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: The 20-Somethings Who Help the 70-Somethings Run Washington
description: WASHINGTON  When an alarmed Representative Kevin McCarthy, the minority leader, called the White House on Jan. 6, 2021, demanding to know why the president of the United States had suggested he was coming to the Capitol while Congress met to certify his election defeat, the person on the other end of the line had just turned 25 years old.

title: A Transformative Term at the Most Conservative Supreme Court in Nearly a Century
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court moved relentlessly to the right in its first full term with a six-justice conservative majority, issuing far-reaching decisions that will transform American life. It eliminated the constitutional right to abortion, recognized a Second Amendment right to carry guns outside the home, made it harder to address climate change and expanded the role of religion in public life.

title: Germany Begins Return of Benin Bronzes to Nigeria
description: Germany returned two of the priceless artifacts known as the Benin Bronzes to Nigeria on Friday, after reaching a political agreement that could soon see hundreds more return to the country from which they were looted over 100 years ago.

title: A Lentil Soup With Its Heart in Armenia
description: For her birthday, my friend Audrey wanted one thing: a lentil soup from Yerevan Market and Cafe, an Armenian spot in the Adams Morgan neighborhood of Washington, D.C.

title: Richard Taruskin, Vigorously Polemical Musicologist, Dies at 77
description: Richard Taruskin, a commanding musicologist and public intellectual whose polemical scholarship and criticism upended conventional classical music history, died early Friday in Oakland, Calif. He was 77.

title: What Are the Common Complications of a Colonoscopy?
description: Travis Barker, an American musician and drummer for the rock band Blink-182, was hospitalized on June 28 with pancreatitis, TMZ first reported. The musician had endured extreme stomach pain, according to People magazine, and was later wheeled into Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles on a stretcher and accompanied by his wife, Kourtney Kardashian.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Kate Shaw
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Kate Shaw. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: Tunisias President Drafts Constitution Giving Himself Broad Powers
description: CAIRO  Tunisias president has taken another major step toward dismantling the countrys young democracy in a newly released draft constitution, giving himself broad powers while diluting those of Parliament and the judiciary.

title: How a Paramedic (and Memoirist) Spends His Sundays
description: Anthony Almojera is a paramedic and a lieutenant for the New York City Fire Department, working out of Station 40 in Sunset Park, Brooklyn. He is also the author of a new memoir, Riding the Lightning: A Year in the Life of a New York City Paramedic, which chronicles his experiences during the worst part of the pandemic in the city, and his recovery from a deep depression, including a suicide attempt.

title: New York City ends its coronavirus alert system as cases hit high levels.
description: New York City suddenly removed its color-coded coronavirus alert system on Thursday just as newer Omicron subvariants are fueling another rise in cases and hospitalizations.

title: Epic Tacos
description: I had originally planned to talk about burgers with you today  these clever fast and juicy smash burgers from J. Kenji Lpez-Alt in particular. Its the Fourth of July. I get it. I also like a good hamburger, and thats a really good hamburger.

title: Director of the Chinati Foundation in Marfa to Step Down
description: Jenny Moore and the board of trustees of the Chinati Foundation announced on Friday that Moore will step down on July 31, after nine years as the director of the contemporary art museum.

title: Meet the Man Bringing Drama and Joy to Brooklyns Nightlife Spaces
description: Push open the right unassuming black door beneath the elevated subway tracks at the Myrtle Avenue/Broadway stop in Brooklyn and youll enter a smoky room filled with hazy lights and neon orbs.

title: Brittney Griners case in Russia appears to be the latest example of hostage diplomacy.
description: Brittney Griner, the W.N.B.A. athlete facing drug charges in Russia as Moscow presses ahead with its war in Ukraine, may be merely the latest victim of a practice so common it has its own name: hostage diplomacy.

title: A Win for the Coal Industry, a Loss for the Planet
description: To the Editor:

title: Solveig Gold Is Proud to Be the Wife of a Canceled Princeton Professor
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  Solveig Lucia Gold was setting the table in her backyard, next door to the house once occupied by Albert Einstein. Her yard is a sweeping field of emerald green grass leading down to the 18th-century blacksmiths cottage with stone floors that houses her home study.

title: New York Moves to Enshrine Abortion Rights in State Constitution
description: ALBANY, N.Y.  The New York State Legislature on Friday passed a measure that, if fully enacted, would enshrine in the State Constitution the right to seek an abortion and access contraception.

title: H.T. Chen, Choreographer of the Asian Experience, Dies at 74
description: H.T. Chen, who blended Eastern and Western influences in his choreography, and who with his wife, Dian Dong, established the Chen Dance Center, a cultural hub in New Yorks Chinatown for more than 40 years, died on June 12 in Manhattan. He was 74.

title: Review: The Mutes Gives Voice to Musical Outsiders
description: PARIS  The first time I sang, it was by ear. I imagine thats often the case. Toddlers join their favorite characters in Disney movies or echo their parents with mumbled renditions of Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star. When children begin to sing in school, they usually learn not from scores, but from lyrics memorized through repetition.

title: In Louisiana, Abortion Clinics Stay Open on Borrowed Time
description: On July 8, a judge will consider whether an abortion ban can go forward. Until then, a Shreveport facility intends to serve as many women as possible.

title: How Delta-8 THC Works, and Why Experts Are Worried About It
description: Over the past few years, you may have seen headlines about a drug called delta-8. Google searches for the term grew by more than 850 percent in the United States between 2020 and 2021, particularly in states where recreational marijuana is illegal. According to one recent study, 16 percent of regular marijuana users also use delta-8.

title: The Best of Late Night This Week
description: The late-night hosts had no shortage of news to riff on this week, including Supreme Court decisions and Cassidy Hutchinsons Trump testimony.

title: Wonking Out: Taking the Flation Out of Stagflation
description: A funny thing happened on the way to the Federal Reserves latest rate hike. The Fed went big on June 15, raising the interest rates it controls by 75 basis points, or 0.75 percentage points  a sharp rise for an institution that usually tries to move gradually. Why the urgency? As Jerome Powell, the Fed chairman, made clear, he and his colleagues were afraid that expectations of inflation were becoming unanchored, which some economists argue could lead to inflation becoming entrenched. (The trench is losing its anchor? Time to call in the mixed-metaphor police? Never mind.)

title: Review: In Corps, Running Aspirational Dance Drills
description: When you hear the words, Snaps: Go! you know that Milka Djordjevichs Corps has begun. On Thursday at New York Live Arts, five women descended the stairs through the audience in a single-file line, walking and snapping in time. As they advanced across the stage, a second call  No-head: Go!  sounded from the group. To their unison steps and snaps, they added heads turning from side to side.

title: So Youre Rivals? And Youre Fake-Dating? Classic.
description: If she werent a writer, Bolu Babalola could be a great cultural anthropologist. Her work is rife with observations that have the richness of field notes. In ethnography, the way she writes would be called thick description  its precise, layered and interpretive. In her debut romance novel, Honey and Spice, Babalola trains her keen eye and considerable wit on young Black British society.

title: The Secret to Summers Best No-Sweat Dessert
description: I didnt fully understand the appeal of chocolate mousse until a decade ago, when I had it at the home of my friends Cecile and Tom Renna. They hosted brunch on a July afternoon so oppressively humid, I couldnt imagine eating much at all.

title: 53% Of Review: Zinging Pro-Trump Women, and Everyone Else
description: In America, to vote in a federal election is to commit a secret act. One votes in private, in a curtained booth, on intimate terms with an oversize ballot. But little in American public life stays private for long.

title: A Novel About Brilliant Young Game Designers
description: Gabrielle Zevins new novel, Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, is set in the world of video game design, and follows two friends named Sadie and Sam as they collaborate on what becomes a very successful game.

title: Denmarks Leader Apologizes for Botched Mink Cull During Pandemic
description: When Denmark ordered the culling of its entire population of mink in late 2020 over fears that a mutated version of the coronavirus that had infected mink could diminish the effectiveness of vaccines, millions of animals were killed and farmers were left reeling by a financial burden that Danish taxpayers ultimately will shoulder.

title: Will There Be Enough Monkeypox Vaccine?
description: As the United States begins a vaccination campaign against monkeypox, concerns are mounting among some experts that the demand may soon far exceed the available supply.

title: London Modern and Contemporary Auctions: A Market Minus the Froth
description: This week, while some of the worlds top tennis players were in action at Wimbledon, and war continued to rage in Ukraine, Christies, Sothebys and Phillips held their traditional summer week of marquee modern and contemporary art auctions in the British capital.

title: Ending a Decade-Long Decline, More Mexicans Are Migrating to U.S.
description: SAN MARCOS ATESQUILAPAN, Mexico  The teenage brothers were among some 80 young men who had left San Marcos in the last two months, a growing exodus from this impoverished village of 1,600 that sits in the lush mountains of Veracruz state.

title: UNESCO recognizes borscht as a Ukrainian dish in urgent need of safeguarding.
description: It was a minor victory for Ukraine in a larger war for the countrys identity as the Russian army continues its deadly onslaught, attempting to manifest through force of arms President Vladimir V. Putins vision of Ukraine as part of Russia.

title: New in Paperback: Susan Orlean and Brandon Taylor
description: UNTIL JUSTICE BE DONE: Americas First Civil Rights Movement, from the Revolution to Reconstruction, by Kate Masur. (Norton, 496 pp., $20.) In this cleareyed and revelatory book, as the Times critic Jennifer Szalai called it, Masur traces a struggle for racial equality going back to the early days of the republic and recounts the victories that led to achievements such as the Civil Rights Act of 1866 and the 14th Amendment.

title: Will Companies Help Their Employees Get Abortions?
description: Like it or not, business owners are being sucked into the fight over abortion. Now that the Supreme Court has ended the federal protection of abortion rights, the battle has moved on to whether companies will help their employees get abortions in any way, including by reimbursing them for expenses to travel out of state to obtain a legal procedure.

title: Stop Asking Those Closest to Tragedy to Do the Heaviest Lifting
description: Nearly a decade has passed since my daughter, Ana Grace, was shot and killed along with 19 other children and six staff members at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn. If youre looking for a familys tragedy to triumph narrative, as I suspect many are, I cant give that to you.

title: Whats happening in the states? Heres the latest on which abortion laws are in effect and which are blocked.
description: A tug of war over the future of abortion access is playing out in courts across the United States after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, adding to a legal landscape defined by uncertainty, confusion and rapid change.

title: Visiting Venice? Make a Reservation and Be Ready to Pay.
description: ROME  Traveling to Venice? Get ready to pay for the privilege of visiting the city, one of the most beautiful on earth. Oh, and be sure to reserve your spot.

title: With Climate Agenda Stalled at Home, Biden Still Hopes to Lead Abroad
description: On his first day in office, President Biden recommitted the United States to the Paris climate agreement, noting in his inaugural address that a cry for survival comes from the planet itself. A cry that cant be any more desperate or any more clear.

title: The Weekender
description: The art of falconry at the Jersey Shore. Also in this edition: why armed robbers want your French bulldog, and a profile of Taika Waititi.

title: Advanced U.S. Arms Make a Mark in Ukraine War, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  The most advanced weapons that the United States has so far supplied Ukraine are making an impact in their first several days on the battlefield, destroying Russian ammunition depots and command centers, American and Ukrainian officials say.

title: Love Letter: Our Brilliant $100 Bet
description: When I first read Mark Jason Williamss essay in the Modern Love submission inbox, I laughed, sighed and nodded.

title: Why Is There So Much Turmoil in Eastern Congo?
description: At its worst point, it was labeled Africas World War, a transnational conflict that cost millions of peoples lives. At best over the past decades, there has been a fragile peace. But there has never been a definitive end to the conflict in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: Biden Will Award Medal of Freedom to Simone Biles, John McCain and Others
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden announced on Friday that he will present the Presidential Medal of Freedom next week to 17 leaders from the worlds of politics, civil rights, sports, business, education and entertainment, including the Olympic gymnast Simone Biles, the actor Denzel Washington and the first American to receive a Covid-19 vaccine.

title: The Supreme Court Sabotages Efforts to Protect Public Health and Safety
description: On Thursday, the Supreme Courts conservative majority, with its 6-3 ruling in the case of West Virginia v. Environmental Protection Agency, curtailed the power of the agency to protect the environment, and specifically to require the reductions in emissions that are urgently necessary to limit global warming.

title: Father of Technoblade, YouTube Minecraft Star, Says His Son Has Died
description: Technoblade, a YouTube personality who built a following of millions with his wry commentary on videos of himself playing Minecraft, has died, his father announced in a video posted on his sons account.

title: Corruption in Ukraine
description: Hello. This is your Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, a weeknight guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: A Taste of Alta California
description: Wes Avilas unassuming breakfast sandwich shop in Los Angeles is so much more than it seems.

title: From a Chefs Burnout, a Singular Los Angeles Restaurant Emerges
description: Wes Avila made his name popping up around Los Angeles selling wildly expressive tacos, his improbable mission in the name: Guerrilla Tacos.

title: Pandemic-battered movie theaters are feeling good after a strong June.
description: For two years, the film industry lived in genuine fear about the future of moviegoing, with no one able to say for sure whether cinemas would recover from the coronavirus pandemic. Sitting in the dark in a theater to watch moving images  a 117-year-old American pastime that was already in long, slow decline  may well have encountered its extinction-of-the-dinosaurs moment.

title: California Requires Plastics Makers to Foot the Bill for Recycling
description: In one of the most ambitious statewide attempts to reduce dependence on plastics, California instituted a new requirement that makers of packaging pay for recycling and reduce or eliminate single-use plastic packaging.

title: Where Does the Climate Movement Go Next?
description: The year was 1989. Al Gore was writing about countries that now no longer exist and world leaders who are no longer alive. But his message was the same: Earths fate is the No. 1 national security issue.

title: From the Early Morning Sky, Shards of Hot Metal
description: SERHIIVKA, Ukraine  His forehead cut from his rescue efforts in the rubble of a hotel in this sleepy southern resort town, Oleksandr Mararenko carried out the bodies of a woman and child early Friday morning after a Russian missile attack.

title: Jaylon Ferguson, Baltimore Ravens Linebacker, Died From an Overdose
description: Jaylon Ferguson, an outside linebacker with the Baltimore Ravens who died last month after being found unresponsive in a North Baltimore home, died from the combined effects of fentanyl and cocaine, the authorities said on Friday.

title: Swimmer at Long Island Beach May Have Been Bitten by Shark, Police Say
description: A man swimming at Jones Beach on Long Island on Thursday may have been bitten by a shark, according to the Nassau County Police Department.

title: Did the Freedom Convoy Change the Meaning of Canadas Flag?
description: Whether you were in Surrey, British Columbia, or Coutts, Alberta, or Windsor, Ontario  or, especially, if you were in Ottawa  you saw a sea of red-and-white Canadian flags rippling in the winter wind during this years protests against the federal government and pandemic mandates, known to some as the Freedom Convoy.

title: From Star Athlete to Political Pawn: Griner Goes on Trial in Russia
description: Brittney Griner arrived in Russia in February to play basketball, one of the sports biggest stars. She arrived in a courtroom outside Moscow on Friday as something else entirely  a potential bargaining chip in Russias tense standoff with the West over the war in Ukraine, described by supporters as a hostage of the Kremlin.

title: Partying in a Pandemic
description: For the past few years, Covid has made it complicated  or outright impossible  to go out on the town in New York.

title: Can I Wear Sneakers With a Dress?
description: Given that Serena Williams wore sneakers with her Versace gown at the Met Gala a few years ago, and since then weve had two years of social isolation and comfort dressing, its fair to say that at this point sneakers with everything, everywhere is a thing  for pretty much everybody.

title: Biden Administration Offers an Offshore Drilling Plan. Likely Backers: Very Few.
description: WASHINGTON  The Biden administration announced its plan for oil and gas drilling off the coasts of the United States, closing off the possibility of new leases in the Atlantic, Pacific and Arctic Oceans but potentially allowing new lease sales in both the Gulf of Mexico and in Cook Inlet in Alaska.

title: Inside the Extreme Effort to Punish Women for Abortion
description: Hours after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade last week, a man with a wiry, squared-off beard and a metal cross around his neck celebrated with his team at a Brazilian steakhouse. He pulled out his phone to livestream to his followers.

title: Power 5? College Sports May Soon Be Dominated by a Mighty 2.
description: For about a year, George Kliavkoff cut an unruffled image as the Pac-12 Conferences new commissioner.

title: The Giant African Land Snail Has Been Spotted Again in Florida
description: MIAMI  The giant African land snail, which can grow to the size of a fist and carry a parasite that causes meningitis, was declared eradicated from South Florida last year after a decade-long battle of people versus pests.

title: Is There Anything Funny About the War in Ukraine?
description: LVIV, Ukraine  Some morsels of news are so grim and absurd that they sound like they were conceived in the warped imagination of bored satirists. Like the headline from Belarus a few weeks ago, reporting that 10th graders there were being taught how to aim rifles  using shovels.

title: Trump Media is subpoenaed in federal inquiry of Truth Social deal.
description: The investigation by federal prosecutors and securities regulators into a proposed merger between a cash-rich blank check company and former President Donald J. Trumps social media company has gotten closer to Mr. Trumps end of the deal.

title: Vladimir Zelenko, 48, Dies; Promoted an Unfounded Covid Treatment
description: Vladimir Zelenko, a self-described simple country doctor from New York State who rocketed to prominence in the early days of the Covid-19 pandemic when his controversial treatment for the coronavirus gained White House support, died on Thursday in Dallas. He was 48.

title: Russia Detains Its Olympic Goalie, Who Had Signed With the Philadelphia Flyers
description: A Russian hockey player who recently signed with the Philadelphia Flyers has been detained in Russia on charges that he planned to evade military service, according to reports from Russian news outlets.

title: Google Says It Will Delete Location Data When Users Visit Abortion Clinics
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google said on Friday that it would delete abortion clinic visits from the location history of its users, in the companys first effort to address how it will handle sensitive data in the wake of the Supreme Court overturning Roe v. Wade.

title: A Thriller Plugged Into the Overheated Global Power Grid
description: Its challenging to write a noir novel set in the modern world. After all, a reliable aspect of classic noir is that the shiny veneer of a placid community is ripped away, revealing teeming rot and societal corruption underneath. (Think of James Ellroys L.A. Confidential or David Lynchs film Blue Velvet.) How, then, do you set a noir in a current global moment when it feels like rot and corruption are festering all too often in plain sight for everyone to see?

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Tennis Gets Another Fairy Tale, Maybe the Craziest One Yet
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Tennis has had its share of come-out-of-nowhere stories in recent years. A qualifier named Emma Raducanu won the U.S. Open last September. The sport is as deep as it has ever been.

title: Woman and Female Didnt Start as Words About Men
description: English words referring to or meaning woman have interesting histories. In the current political moment, I thought I might share some of them. Each can help us think about ways we may perceive the humanity around us.

title: N.Y. Lawmakers Respond on Guns and Abortion After Supreme Court Rulings
description: A week after the Supreme Court issued monumental rulings loosening restrictions on carrying guns and overturning the constitutional right to abortion, New York enacted sweeping measures designed to blunt the decisions effects.

title: Trying to Capture the Life and Lyrics of That Wry Sage Leonard Cohen
description: The documentary Hallelujah: Leonard Cohen, a Journey, a Song illuminates the unpredictable paths taken by a singer-songwriter and his music. The directors, Dan Geller and Dayna Goldfine (Ballets Russes), trace Cohens career from his early days in Montreal to his 21st-century renaissance, exploring his creative process, his spiritual search and how his perhaps best-known song, Hallelujah, took on a life of its own.

title: Iga Swiatek, a World No. 1, Gets Comfortable Using Her Clout
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Iga Swiatek, cap still pulled low after her latest victory, was sitting in a players caf perched high above the All England Club and the grass she is still learning to love.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Prepares Meta Employees for a Tougher 2022
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Mark Zuckerberg has a message for Meta employees: Buckle up for tough times ahead.

title: Jan. 6 Witness Anthony Ornato Is at the Center of a Battle Over Credibility
description: Anthony M. Ornato had left his role as the Secret Service agent in charge of President Donald J. Trumps protective detail in late 2019 when the culture of internal strife that Mr. Trump fostered throughout his term left the presidents top advisers frantically searching for a candidate to fill a key role: deputy White House chief of staff for operations.

title: N.Y.C. Becomes First to Offer Paxlovid at Mobile Testing Sites
description: New York City launched the first mobile testing units in the United States that will immediately prescribe the antiviral treatment Paxlovid to people who test positive for the coronavirus.

title: The Perils of Slow Vote-Counting and Delayed Election Results
description: What happens when Election Day lasts for weeks?

title: Oklahoma Plans to Execute 25 Prisoners in 29 Months
description: An Oklahoma court on Friday set execution dates for 25 death row prisoners, setting up a string of executions that would take place nearly every month over the next two years.

title: Trump Eyes Early 2024 Announcement as Jan. 6 Scrutiny Intensifies
description: Republicans are bracing for Donald J. Trump to announce an unusually early bid for the White House, a move designed in part to shield the former president from a stream of damaging revelations emerging from investigations into his attempts to cling to power after losing the 2020 election.

title: The Best Movies and TV Shows Coming to HBO, Hulu, Apple TV+ and More in July
description: (Note: Streaming services occasionally change schedules without giving notice. For more recommendations on what to stream, sign up for our Watching newsletter here.)

title: What Is the Abortion Abolitionist Movement?
description: How a fringe faction has started to gain steam post Roe.

title: Babys Father Arrested in Shooting of Woman Who Was Walking Stroller
description: A 22-year-old man was arrested in connection with the death of Azsia Johnson, a 20-year-old mother who was fatally shot at point blank range on Wednesday as she pushed her 3-month-old daughter in a stroller while on a walk on the Upper East Side, the police announced.

title: Kentucky Man Shoots 6 Officers, Killing 3, Police Say
description: Three law enforcement officers were killed and three other officers were shot on Thursday night after a man barricaded in his home opened fire with a rifle in Allen, Ky., a rural town so small that it lacks its own police force, the authorities said.

title: Tick or Tock
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  This grid is a neat accomplishment. Its Evan Kalishs first Saturday puzzle, and he has now hit for the cycle as a constructor of at least one daily puzzle for all seven days of the week, plus a variety puzzle (a vowel-less crossword, if youre interested in trng smthng nw).

title: How to Watch Fourth of July Fireworks in New York City
description: While a number of cities are canceling Fourth of July fireworks this year because of staff and supply shortages, among other reasons, New York City will still celebrate the holiday with a fiery show.

title: Ill Prepared for Combat, Volunteers Die in Battles Far From Home
description: RUDNE, Ukraine  Yurii Brukhal, an electrician by trade, did not have a very dangerous role when he volunteered for Ukraines territorial defense forces at the start of the war. He was assigned to make deliveries and staff a checkpoint in the relative safety of his sleepy village.

title: Quotation of the Day: Long Live the Theater in Mariupol, Now Gone
description: There is a saying: The king is dead. Long live the king. So, the theater died. Long live the theater.

title: Corrections: July 2, 2022
description: An article on Friday about the Supreme Court ruling that allows the Biden administration to end a Trump-era immigration program that forces asylum seekers at the southwestern border to await approval in Mexico described incorrectly the history of immigration legislation. Congress has made changes to immigration law since 1986, but it has not passed any law to legalize undocumented immigrants since that year.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SATURDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: The Federal Government Subsidizes Abortions. Will That Last?
description: In the United States, you can get a tax deduction for your abortion if your overall health care expenses are high enough. That didnt change with the Supreme Courts ruling last week.

title: Inflation Is Posing 19 Problems for One Central Bank
description: SINTRA, Portugal  For central bankers, the world has changed abruptly. After more than a decade of low inflation and interest rates, policymakers are now in an environment of high inflation, where there isnt time for ponderous decisions, only swift and decisive action.

title: How the Russian Media Spread False Claims About Ukrainian Nazis
description: An analysis of nearly eight million articles about Ukraine from Russian websites shows that references to Nazism have spiked to unprecedented levels during the war.

title: How Do I Prove That I Can Pay the Rent if I Dont Have a Monthly Salary?
description: Q: Im a retiree with no income but significant liquidity, and Im wondering how a person without a traditional source of income can qualify for an apartment when landlords typically require renters to show proof that they earn 40 times the monthly rent. I have to believe that mine is not an uncommon situation. What are other ways I can prove to a prospective landlord that I can pay the rent?

title: Did the Supreme Court Open the Door to Reviving One of Its Worst Decisions?
description: In the annals of the Supreme Court, few opinions have been more reviled than the 1905 decision in Lochner v. New York.

title: N.Y. Beaches Step Up Shark Patrols With Drones, Trackers and Tourniquets
description: LIDO BEACH, N.Y.  It was a classic early summer Friday at Point Lookout Beach on Long Island, with beachgoers frolicking in the frothy waves and basking under the sunny skies.

title: Yellowstone to Weigh Climate Change Risks When Rebuilding From Flood
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: When Where You Work Determines if You Can Get an Abortion
description: When Breanna Dietrich was 18 and working at a restaurant in West Virginia, she got pregnant. The father was a man she knew she wouldnt marry. She considered getting an abortion. But the nearest clinic was four hours away and she couldnt afford to take off work  so she had the baby girl.

title: Seeing Norma: The Conflicted Life of the Woman at the Center of Roe v. Wade
description: Norma McCorvey, the Jane Roe at the center of Roe v. Wade, was an imperfect plaintiff.

title: Spurred by the Supreme Court, a Nation Divides Along a Red-Blue Axis
description: Pressed by Supreme Court decisions diminishing rights that liberals hold dear and expanding those cherished by conservatives, the United States appears to be drifting apart into separate nations, with diametrically opposed social, environmental and health policies.

title: Webb Telescope Will Look for Signs of Life Way Out There
description: Follow our live coverage of NASAs new James Webb Telescope images here.

title: Japans Secret to Taming the Coronavirus: Peer Pressure
description: TOKYO  To understand how Japan has fared better than most of the world in containing the dire consequences of the coronavirus pandemic, consider Mika Yanagihara, who went shopping for flowers this past week in central Tokyo. Even when walking outside in temperatures in the mid-90s, she kept the lower half of her face fully covered.

title: Skyrocketing Global Fuel Prices Threaten Livelihoods and Social Stability
description: NO ES SUFICIENTE  Its not enough. That was the message protest leaders in Ecuador delivered to the countrys president this past week after he said he would lower the price of both regular gas and diesel by 10 cents in response to riotous demonstrations over soaring fuel and food prices.

title: Five Boroughs, Five Days, One Question
description: New York City is dead forever, that one headline declared. But the truth is, even though the coronavirus pulled the emergency brake and forced the city to a screeching halt, New York soon lurched right back into motion.

title: Ukraine dreams of rebuilding the worlds largest airplane. Can Richard Branson help?
description: Four months ago, at the beginning of the war, countless Ukrainians were demoralized when they learned that the worlds largest cargo airplane, built in Ukraine, was destroyed in a fierce battle.

title: Tropical Storm Colin Expected to Weaken After Dousing the Carolinas
description: Tropical Storm Colin formed early on Saturday morning just off the coast of South Carolina, becoming the third named storm of the 2022 Atlantic hurricane season and threatening to drench outdoor activities over the long Independence Day weekend.

title: Russia Repeatedly Strikes Ukraines Civilians. Theres Always an Excuse.
description: Since late February, when Russia began pummeling Ukraine with missiles and artillery on a scale unseen in Europe for decades, civilian deaths have been as inevitable as the Russian excuses that follow.

title: Japan Swelters Through a Punishing Heat Wave
description: TOKYO  Japan is enduring one of its worst heat waves on record, raising concern about potential power shortages amid surging demand, even as officials urged people to keep their air-conditioners running to ward off heat stroke.

title: A Guide to the Weekend
description: The most reliable way Ive found to discover books I love is by seeking out the recommendations of writers whose work I admire. So when I saw that Patrick Radden Keefe, the author of the riveting Empire of Pain, was discussing his favorite writers in The Times Book Review, I broke out my note-taking app to add Emmanuel Carrres The Adversary to my ever-lengthening list of titles to read.

title: Ukraine accuses Russia of dropping white phosphorus on Snake Island after its retreat.
description: KYIV, Ukraine  Ukraines army has accused Russia of dropping incendiary white phosphorus on Snake Island on Friday, the day after Moscows forces retreated from the strategic rocky outcrop on the southwestern part of the Black Sea that is key to the Kremlins war aims.

title: Searching for Gold, Miners Discover a Frozen Baby Mammoth
description: About a half-hour before his lunch break one June morning, Travis Mudry was operating an excavator and digging through permafrost in the Klondike gold fields of the Yukon in Canada.

title: The Republican War on Sex
description: One day I hope to become a mother. But for now, I have sex just because I like it. Sex is fun.

title: What to Do Now to Prepare for the Next Recession
description: In the face of rising inflation, the Federal Reserve is trying to cool down the economy, raising interest rates by 0.75 percentage point in June, the biggest increase since 1994. Jerome Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, has vowed to try to engineer a soft landing  in which demand drops, bringing prices down, without tipping the economy into a recession and throwing hundreds of thousands of Americans out of their jobs.

title: Ukrainian students are hopeful and defiant as they graduate amid war.
description: UZHHOROD, Ukraine  The teenagers, all wearing white sashes with the word graduate draped across them, clustered together and laughed as they walked through the Old City looking for somewhere to go out.

title: Brittney Griners Detention in Moscow Is Latest in Hostage Diplomacy
description: Brittney Griner, the W.N.B.A. athlete facing criminal drug charges in Russia, may be merely the latest victim of a practice so common it has its own name: hostage diplomacy.

title: In Pakistan, a Leader in Trans Rights, Reality Is Slower to Change Than Law
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  Four years ago, Pakistan stepped to the forefront of transgender rights worldwide, enacting a law that prohibits discrimination against transgender people in schools, workplaces and public settings, and guarantees them the right to choose their gender on official documents.

title: His Union Went on Strike. His Interviews Went Viral.
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Boris Johnson has branded him a union baron, but Mick Lynch, the union leader who is orchestrating the largest railway strikes in Britain in three decades, has emerged from work stoppages that disrupted the plans of millions of people as an unexpected media sensation.

title: Texas Supreme Court Lifts Freeze on Abortion Ban
description: The Texas Supreme Court allowed a 1925 law banning abortion to take effect late on Friday night, overturning a lower court ruling that had temporarily blocked it.

title: An Anti-Abortion Victory, but at What Price?
description: To the Editor:

title: Lets Not Pretend Were Keeping Our Promises on Asylum
description: In this restive age of unprecedented human displacement, 100 million people have fled disaster and oppression to try their luck in a world thats increasingly tired of dealing with them.

title: El Salvadors Bitcoin Paradise Is a Mirage
description: SAN SALVADOR  Bitcoiners  enthusiasts of the worlds most popular cryptocurrency  arent supposed to trust government. After all, one of Bitcoins premises is to separate money from the state.

title: The Democrat Whos Flipping the Campaign Script
description: ROCK HALL, Md.  When Dave Harden decided to run for Congress as a Democrat on Marylands conservative Eastern Shore, a friend gave him a piece of free advice.

title: The American Flag Belongs to Me, Too, and This Year Im Taking It Back
description: NASHVILLE  We bought our house from a military veteran who hauled his flag out on every officially patriotic occasion. It hung from a flag mount embedded in the bark of a maple tree, and during our first years in the house we followed suit, at least on the Fourth of July.

title: This regional leader is a symbol of Ukrainian defiance.
description: To win the war, says Vitaliy Kim, you need to love the war.

title: Will Reactionaries Impose a Red-State Social Order on the Rest of Us?
description: One way to understand the work of the Republican Party and its six-member majority on the Supreme Court is to think about the American political system in terms of its defensive and offensive potential. Here, a historical example is in order.

title: Gridlock in Congress Has Amplified the Power of the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  On the last day of a turbulent term that included rulings on what the Constitution has to say about abortion, guns and religion, the Supreme Court issued another sort of decision, one that turned on the words of the Clean Air Act.

title: Russia Steps Up Pace of Missile Attacks on Residential Targets
description: KYIV, Ukraine  An attack on a shopping mall on Monday, killing 19 civilians. A missile strike on a sleepy resort town on Friday, claiming the lives of at least 21 residents. Cluster bombs on Saturday hit a residential block in an industrial hub, leaving four dead.

title: Swiatek, the World No. 1, Falls at Wimbledon, Ending a Long Win Streak
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Iga Swiatek, the world No. 1 and the top seed at Wimbledon, did something she had not done in more than four months Saturday. She lost a tennis match.

title: Tesla Sales Slow as the Pandemic Hobbles Production
description: Tesla said Saturday that vehicle deliveries from April through June fell 18 percent from the first quarter of the year, a rare slowdown for the company caused by production problems in China.

title: Ukraines Lesia Tsurenko Plays Tennis for the Money
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Lesia Tsurenkos Wimbledon campaign ended Friday during a match in which her head was someplace else.

title: The fight for the last city in Luhansk under Ukrainian control reaches a pivotal point.
description: WARSAW, Poland  Ukraine appeared to be pulling some troops and equipment out of Lysychansk as Russia-allied forces said Saturday that they had advanced to the center of the strategic city in eastern Ukraine after days of heavy fighting, according to Russian state media and interviews with Ukrainian troops.

title: On a Long Climb to the Top, She Makes Short Work of an Opponent
description: Kayla Harrisons second bout of the Professional Fighters League regular season unfolded as predictably as the betting odds  tilted heavily in her favor  suggested.

title: In City Where Europe Starts, Ethnic Russians Start Questioning Putins War
description: NARVA, Estonia  Like many of the ethnic Russians who live along Estonias eastern border with Russia, Stanislava Larchenko could not believe that President Vladimir V. Putin had gone on a killing spree in Ukraine.

title: Former Georgetown Tennis Coach Sentenced to More Than 2 Years in Varsity Blues Case
description: A former Georgetown University head tennis coach who pleaded guilty last fall to accepting bribes to help prospective students gain admission to the school was sentenced Friday to more than two years in prison, according to the U.S. attorneys office for the District of Massachusetts.

title: The Long Path to Reclaim Abortion Rights
description: Attempting to recover from their staggering loss in the Supreme Court, abortion rights groups have mounted a multilevel legal and political attack aimed at blocking and reversing abortion bans in courts and at ballot boxes across the country.

title: Bruce Katz, Pioneer of the Walking Shoe, Is Dead at 75
description: Bruce Katz, who with his father started the Rockport Shoe Company in 1971 and established walking shoes as a vibrant footwear category, died on June 26 in Greenbrae, Calif. He was 75.

title: Akron Police Officers Placed on Leave After Fatal Shooting of Black Man
description: An unspecified number of police officers in Akron, Ohio, were placed on administrative leave after the fatal shooting of a 25-year-old Black man who the police said continued to drive after they tried to pull him over for an unspecified traffic violation.

title: Palestinians Give U.S. Experts Bullet That Killed Journalist
description: JERUSALEM  The Palestinian Authority has handed over to a team of American investigators the bullet it says killed the Palestinian American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, Palestinian officials said on Saturday, in a move meant to clarify the circumstances of the reporters death.

title: A Mother and Her 3 Children Are Found Dead in a Minnesota Lake
description: The bodies of a mother and her three children, two boys and one girl, were recovered in a lake outside Saint Paul, Minn., and the authorities said they were investigating it as a possible triple murder-suicide.

title: Expansion Pack
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  This grid marks the Sunday return of Tom McCoy after a far-too-long absence  nearly two years  that likely corresponds to a period of intense study. Mr. McCoy, who lives in Wexford, Pa., recently defended his doctoral dissertation in cognitive science at Johns Hopkins University, on the subject of how language is represented in artificial intelligence systems and what that tells us about language in humans. This fall, he will begin a postdoctoral program at Princeton, which might be easier to juggle with crossword construction (probably wishful thinking on my part).

title: Thousands of Flights Are Delayed or Canceled as Holiday Travel Kicks Off
description: Travelers across the country faced the prospect of canceled or delayed flights on Saturday as airlines and airports dealt with a combination of high demand, bad weather and staffing shortages.

title: Uvalde Schools Police Chief Resigns From City Council
description: Pete Arredondo, the chief of the school district police force in Uvalde, Texas, resigned as a member of the Uvalde City Council on Friday amid continued outrage over the slow police response to a shooting at Robb Elementary School in May.

title: Supreme Court Marshal Asks Officials to End Protests at Justices Homes
description: WASHINGTON  The chief security officer of the Supreme Court has asked that Virginia and Maryland officials enforce laws that would prohibit protests outside the homes of justices after weeks of demonstrations favoring abortion rights.

title: Man Dies After Truck Propelled by Jet Engines Crashes at Michigan Air Show
description: The driver of a truck that could top 350 miles per hour because it was powered by jet engines died after the vehicle crashed on Saturday while racing two airplanes at an air show in Michigan, officials said.

title: Investigators of War Crimes in Ukraine Face Formidable Challenges
description: KOROPY, Ukraine  Four men tugged at long strips of fabric to lift a coffin out of the gaping hole in the backyard of a small house. They flung the lid open to reveal the moldy corpse of Oleksiy Ketler, who had been killed instantly by shrapnel when a mortar fell on the road in Koropy, a village outside Kharkiv in northeastern Ukraine, in March.

title: Corrections: July 3, 2022
description: An article last Sunday about George Michael misstated the location of his childhood home. It was in Edgware, not East Finchley.

title: Four killed after explosions in a Russian city near the Ukraine border.
description: Explosions hit the center of a Russian city just north of Ukraine early Sunday, killing four, officials said, in the deadliest known episode affecting civilians in Russia since the start of the war.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SUNDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: She Wanted to Celebrate by Eating at Her Favorite Hot Pot Restaurant
description: Dear Diary:

title: How a Military Base in Illinois Helps Keep Weapons Flowing to Ukraine
description: SCOTT AIR FORCE BASE, Ill.  In a room dimly lit by television screens, dozens of airmen tapped away at computers and worked the phones. Some were keeping watch over a high-priority mission to move a Russian-made Mi-17 helicopter from a base in Arizona to a destination near Ukraines border.

title: Once a Crucial Refuge, Gayborhoods Lose L.G.B.T.Q. Residents in Major Cities
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Cleve Jones has lived in the Castro neighborhood for nearly 50 years, almost from the day he graduated from high school in Phoenix and hitchhiked to California.

title: The Pro-Life Generation: Young Women Fight Against Abortion Rights
description: DALLAS  The rollback of abortion rights has been received by many American women with a sense of shock and fear, and warnings about an ominous decline in womens status as full citizens.

title: Quotation of the Day: Gayborhoods Falling Victim to Rents and Social Change
description: Gayborhoods are going away. People need to pay attention to this. When people are dispersed, when they no longer live in geographic concentrations, when they no longer inhabit specific precincts, we lose a lot. We lose political power.

title: Father Figure: The Tortured Life of George Michael
description: In 1993, Princess Diana asked her friend George Michael to help organize a benefit concert for World AIDS Day. He came through magnificently, lining up the other acts and delivering a strong and heartfelt headlining set of his own. Then when it came time for the show to air as a TV special, the English singer insisted on seeing the footage, altering the sequence of performers and recutting the shots of himself onstage because he thought his butt looked big. According to a former BBC producer, Never work with children, animals or George Michael became an industry mantra after that.

title: Pay Attention to These Old Women. Youll Learn Something.
description: Novels featuring older characters are well suited to an exploration of questions about time, history and change. Unlike younger protagonists, they already know who theyve become and what theyve made of their lives. Theyre not finished yet, but they are as busy reckoning with the past as they are living in the present. They are in full possession of the bulk of their lifes trajectory, so their primary aim is to resolve and make sense of things before they die.

title: A Mermaid Makes for a Strange Kind of Immigrant
description: Off the shores of Black Conch, an imagined island in the Caribbean, in 1976, two American white men and a crew of Black island sailors hook a mermaid and wrestle her out of the water. Almost all the sailors experience a deep unease, a sense of blasphemy, at the act of capture: So close, she was terrifying, a person there, no doubt about it; a trapped and dying woman.
