description: Howdy! Its Tanya, Tejals Veggie editor and enthusiastic understudy. While shes on vacation this week, Im diving into some reader emails. The question on so many of your minds right now: How does one eat well outside this summer?

title: A Pop Star Tried to Reconcile Russia and Ukraine. War Ruined That.
description: Ivan Dorn, a Ukrainian musician, had mostly finished his first album in five years by February.

title: Whats Next for Jack Harlow?
description: The rise of Jack Harlow has been one of hip-hops most curious narratives over the past two years. So far in 2022 hes had a huge pop hit, First Class, and released his second major label album, Come Home the Kids Miss You, which debuted at No. 3. He is one of hip-hops biggest emerging stars, and one whose aims are purely centrist.

title: Inside a New Arts Program for Queens Teens
description: There's a new yearlong social justice and arts institute for teenagers at the Queens Museum.

title: Donna Ferratos Camera Is a Weapon for Women
description: Even with blackened eyes, the women in Donna Ferratos photographs look defiant, not defeated. A photojournalist and feminist activist who is best known for her documentation of domestic violence, Ferrato, 73, has also depicted women pursuing sexual pleasure, giving birth, raising children, enticing men and demonstrating in the streets. Her subject is women taking control of their bodies, and in her fiercely empathetic mission, sometimes she turns the camera on herself.

title: James Caan, Actor Who Won Fame in The Godfather, Dies at 82
description: James Caan, who built a durable film career in varied roles across six decades but was forever identified most closely with one of his earliest characters, the quick-tempered, skirt-chasing Sonny Corleone in the original Godfather movie, died on Wednesday. He was 82.

title: Brittney Griner Pleads Guilty to Drug Charges in Russian Court
description: Brittney Griner pleaded guilty to drug charges in a Russian courtroom on Thursday, as the wrangling over the American basketball stars fate shifted increasingly to the diplomatic arena  a daunting prospect for Ms. Griners supporters amid Americas rift with Moscow over the war in Ukraine.

title: Tech Is Not Representative Government
description: Americans are treating tech companies like a substitute for effective representative government. It shouldnt be this way.

title: How to Follow the News Without Spiraling into Despair
description: Following nonstop news in an era of gun violence, war and political divide can become overwhelming. And amid our many ongoing challenges  the pandemic, climate change, economic uncertainty  its understandable to feel sad, angry and anxious.

title: Monkeypox Vaccine Rollout Is Marred by Glitches in New York
description: Thousands of New Yorkers spent hours refreshing a city government webpage this week, desperately seeking a monkeypox vaccine that, for now, is mostly going to the web-savvy and connected.

title: The Sea Beast Review: Of Monsters and Men
description: Live a great life and die a great death, goes the mantra of the monster hunters in Netflixs new animated movie The Sea Beast. Its a spirited battle cry, sure, but its also a morbid one, made only more grisly by the fact that the first character to say it is a child.

title: I.R.S. Asks Inspector General to Review Audits of Comey and McCabe
description: The I.R.S. said on Thursday that its commissioner, Charles P. Rettig, had asked the inspector general who oversees tax matters to investigate how James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, and his deputy, Andrew G. McCabe  both perceived enemies of former President Donald J. Trump  came to be faced with rare, exhaustive audits that the agency says are supposed to be random.

title: Amazon Hub in Newark Is Canceled After Unions and Local Groups Object
description: For the second time, plans by Amazon to substantially expand its presence in the New York area have been abandoned after labor and community groups mobilized in opposition.

title: Rafael Nadal Withdraws From Wimbledon Ahead of Semifinal Match
description: WIMBLEDON, England  In the end, after a day of contemplation and consideration for what mattered most, health prevailed over the temptations of yet another title.

title: Thor: Love and Thunder Review: A Gods Comic Twilight
description: Every so often in Thor: Love and Thunder, the 92nd Marvel movie to hit theaters this year (OK, the third), the studio machinery hits pause, and the picture opens a portal to another dimension: Its star, Chris Hemsworth, embraces wholesale self-parody, a pair of giant screaming goats gallop along a rainbow highway and Russell Crowe flounces around in a flirty skirt and Shirley Temple curls. As the movie briefly slips into a parallel realm of play and pleasure, you can feel the director Taika Waititi having a good time  and its infectious.

title: The candidates to replace Johnson reflect a more diverse Conservative Party.
description: For years, Britains Conservative Party was seen mainly as the realm of white men from elite backgrounds. But the contenders to replace Boris Johnson as prime minister reflect the growing diversity at the top of the partys ranks.

title: Murina Review: Hunting for Independence on Her Terms
description: The 17-year-old heroine of Murina never seems freer than when shes swimming. Wearing a snorkeling mask, and with a spear gun in one hand, she glides through the water, her strong body propelling her forward. As she descends into the ethereal depths, expertly weaving among the undulating plants and scattering fish, her one-piece suit gleams like a beacon.

title: Black Bird Review: Making Friends With a May-Be Killer
description: Black Bird, a new mini-series on Apple TV+ (premiering Friday) that dramatizes a creepy Midwestern true-crime story from the 1990s, has some significant names attached to it. It was developed for television by the top-flight crime writer Dennis Lehane (The Wire, Mr. Mercedes). Its nominal star, Taron Egerton (Rocketman), is a candidate to be Marvels next Wolverine. And, in a smaller role, it features one of the last performances by Ray Liotta, who died in May.

title: Whats in Our Queue? Dialogues and More
description: Im a deputy editor on The Timess Culture desk. Here are five things I've been reading, listening to and more.

title: No. 2 Theranos Executive Found Guilty of 12 Counts of Fraud
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  Ramesh Balwani, a former top executive at Theranos, was found guilty on Thursday of 12 counts of fraud, in a verdict that was more severe than that of his co-conspirator, Elizabeth Holmes, and that solidified the failed blood-testing start-up as the ultimate Silicon Valley cautionary tale.

title: The Nihilism of the Minions
description: One of the peculiarities of the collective American memory is that we imagine that moral rigidity steadily declines over time. One generation, through experimentation and immense tolerance, disentangles the hang-ups of their parents, just as their children will ultimately do for them. This, of course, is nonsense. Whats particularly odd to me is that most of us are fully aware  at least on an intellectual level  that cultural moralizing ebbs and flows and there is no clear linearity to any of it. But we hold on to the idea that society got freer during our generation (whatever that means) because we want our own youthful indiscretions to have pushed boundaries (another useless phrase) and changed the scope of what was possible (ditto). And while we can usually imagine our own children will take that freedom even further, our narcissism forces us to worry that society will crumble as a result. We, in other words, believe we, and only we, have found the perfect level of moral decline.

title: Rotterdam Wont Dismantle Bridge to Allow Jeff Bezos Superyacht Through
description: Jeff Bezos will not be able to sail a new, more than 400-foot-long superyacht through the waters of the Dutch city of Rotterdam anytime soon.

title: To Pick Johnsons Successor, Britains Conservatives Confront the Void He Leaves Behind
description: LONDON  Rarely free from scandal and never out of the headlines as Britains charismatic prime minister, Boris Johnson dominated British politics, overshadowed his rivals and reinvented his governing Conservative Party in his own compelling, polarizing image.

title: Match Group suspends some political donations after abortion ruling.
description: Facing scrutiny for donations to the Republican Attorneys General Association, whose members supported the overturning of Roe v. Wade, Match Group says it will suspend further contributions to the association as well as the Democratic Attorneys General Association.

title: Robert Colescott Throws Down the Gauntlet
description: Watch out. A raucous, enthralling exhibition of the great American painter Robert Colescott (1925-2009) has arrived at the New Museum, to revel in and dissect. Art and Race Matters: The Career of Robert Colescott is the first museum exhibition of this artists relentlessly provocative work to be seen in Manhattan since a 1989 show (also at the New Museum) and the most complete yet. It reveals a man who was eventually able to meld his own private demons about race with his countrys public ones, creating one of the most compelling, simultaneously personal and socially relevant bodies of work in 20th century American painting.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: The Owl HouseWhen to watch: Now, on Disney+.

title: Dallas Cowboys Face Criticism After Partnership With Black Rifle Coffee
description: The Dallas Cowboys are facing criticism after announcing a new partnership with Black Rifle Coffee, the veteran-owned brand popular with conservatives and gun owners that sells roasts with names like AK Espresso, Murdered Out and Silencer Smooth.

title: More Fed officials back a big July rate move, but downplay recession fears.
description: Two Federal Reserve officials expressed support on Thursday for making a second large rate increase at the central banks upcoming meeting and argued that, while there are early signs that the economy is slowing somewhat, data on gross domestic product overstate the extent of any pullback.

title: How Many Children Does Elon Musk Have?
description: Elon Musk, the billionaire Tesla founder, had twins in November with Shivon Zilis, a director at one of his companies, according to court documents made public on Wednesday. Neither Mr. Musk nor Ms. Zilis has spoken publicly about their children.

title: At the Laundromat Project, Artists Are Ambassadors of Joy and Activism
description: The Laundromat Project was founded two decades ago at a kitchen table on MacDonough Street in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, when Ris Wilson received her first grant money to make art experiences accessible to her neighbors  miles away and a world apart from gatekeeper institutions like the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Raiders Make N.F.L. History With Team President Hire
description: The Las Vegas Raiders hired Sandra Douglass Morgan, the former chairwoman of the Nevada Gaming Control Board, as the teams new president on Thursday. She is the first Black woman to hold the position for an N.F.L. franchise.

title: Killer of George Floyd Sentenced to 21 Years for Violating Civil Rights
description: ST. PAUL, Minn  A white Minneapolis police officer whose murder of a Black man outside a convenience store touched off protests around the world was sentenced to 21 years in federal prison on Thursday, in a case that signaled a new readiness to hold police officers criminally accountable for misconduct.

title: Cabaret Champion Michael Feinstein Teams With Caf Carlyle
description: One of cabarets most famous champions is about to forge a new collaboration with one of its most storied venues, and end his association with another.

title: Washington Post names David Shipley as its opinion editor.
description: The Washington Post named David Shipley, a senior editor at Bloomberg, on Thursday to oversee its opinion section.

title: Cleveland Officer Who Killed Tamir Rice Swiftly Exits New Police Job
description: Two days after Timothy Loehmann, the former Cleveland police officer who shot and killed 12-year-old Tamir Rice in 2014, was sworn in as a police officer for a rural Pennsylvania community, he left the position, the borough of Tioga announced on Thursday.

title: Your Friday Briefing: Boris Johnson Plans to Resign
description: Standing alone at a lectern in front of 10 Downing Street, Boris Johnson announced that he would step down after three years as Britains prime minister, the result of a wholesale rebellion of his cabinet, a wave of government resignations and a devastating loss of party support prompted by recent scandals.

title: The Plight of Brittney Griner
description: Hello. This is your Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, a weeknight guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: Cilantrophilia
description: FollowNew York Times Cooking on Instagram,Facebook,YouTube, TikTokandPinterest.Get regular updates from New York Times Cooking, with recipe suggestions, cooking tips and shopping advice.

title: Harvey Dinnerstein, Proudly Realistic Painter, Is Dead at 94
description: The Montgomery bus boycott was in its early days when Harvey Dinnerstein and his friend Burt Silverman  two socially conscious Realist painters motivated by the lack of photographic evidence of the protests  took the train from Penn Station in Manhattan to Alabama in 1956 to draw that seminal chapter in the nascent civil rights movement.

title: 10 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: Two books on this weeks list are harrowing works of nonfiction: Keri Blakingers Corrections in Ink, a memoir, casts a clear eye on drug addiction and time spent in prison. Marie Brenners The Desperate Hours takes us inside a New York City hospital in the early days of the Covid pandemic.

title: The Fall of Boris Johnson, Explained
description: Britains prime minister Boris Johnson said he would step down less than three years after his landslide election victory, following a series of scandals that have ensnared his government.

title: First, the Fish Fell From the Sky. Then They Washed Ashore.
description: One night last month, Britt Gerhard and her husband heard a bang on the roof of their house in San Francisco around 8 p.m. It was so loud, they thought it was an earthquake.

title: Dont Let Your Wine Go to the Grocery Store Naked
description: Wine is about experience. Its about a subtle taste and a pleasant buzz. The slow crafting of a drink over months and years. It can also be about downing cheap fermented grape juice as fast as possible. Whos to judge?

title: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Fair Play Review: Casting a Floodlight on Invisible Labor
description: The advice included within Eve Rodskys book Fair Play, a guide to sharing domestic labor and achieving harmony in the home, wont blow your mind. A womans time is as valuable as a mans? Who knew! But there is a fortifying effect to arranging these axioms in sequence.

title: Germany paves the way to rescue critical energy providers and gas supplies.
description: German lawmakers approved a measure on Thursday that will allow the government to throw a lifeline to companies struggling with the record-high price of gas and with cuts in supplies from Russia.

title: Ons Jabeur, an Entertainer Who May Soon Be a Wimbledon Champion
description: WIMBLEDON, England  In Tunisia, her home nation and inspiration, Ons Jabeur has acquired the nickname The Minister of Happiness.

title: Texas Governor Orders State Police to Return Migrants to Border
description: HOUSTON  Gov. Greg Abbott on Thursday ordered the Texas National Guard and the state police to begin apprehending migrants who illegally cross the border from Mexico and taking them back to ports of entry, a move that could put the state into direct conflict with the federal government over immigration.

title: Mena, a Well-Received Restaurant in TriBeCa, Will Close
description: Mena, the TriBeCa restaurant led by the chef Victoria Blamey, will close its doors at the Walker Hotel after its last service on Saturday, less than six months after it opened to enthusiastic reviews.

title: Why Mass Shooters Do the Evil They Do
description: I will never get over the fact that our society seems to produce a steady stream of young men who think it is heroic to murder innocent people. I read their histories. I look at the social science research. Ive tried to understand the typical pathway they take to get to their evil behavior.

title: That Was the Stagflation That Was
description: On Wednesday the five-year breakeven inflation rate fell to 2.48 percent. If that doesnt mean anything to you  which is completely forgivable if you arent a professional economy-watcher  try this: The wholesale price of gasoline has fallen about 80 cents a gallon since its peak a month ago. Only a little of this plunge has been passed on to consumers so far, but over the weeks ahead were likely to see a broad decline in prices at the pump.

title: Biden and the Increasingly Anxious Democrats
description: Despite signs that Democrats may be in better shape in the midterms than many expected six months ago, a widespread malaise is setting in within the White House. There is a growing sense that President Biden is not prosecuting a political case against Republicans aggressively enough.

title: Spirit Airlines again puts off a vote on Frontiers offer as it mulls JetBlues.
description: Spirit Airlines said Thursday that it had again delayed a shareholder vote on its proposed acquisition by Frontier Airlines, allowing it to continue discussions with Frontier and with JetBlue Airways, which has made a rival bid.

title: Boris Johnson Quits Amid Latest Scandal, a Messy End to a Messy Tenure
description: LONDON  Bowing to intense pressure from his own party, Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain said Thursday that he would step down, ending a stormy three-year tenure that was marked by a landslide election victory and a successful drive to pull Britain out of the European Union, but collapsed under the weight of relentless scandals.

title: Brittney Griners Supporters Hold Steady After Guilty Plea
description: For the first time in a while, Terri Jackson, the executive director of the W.N.B.A. players union, felt hopeful about Brittney Griner.

title: After Roe, South Carolina Considers More Restrictions on Abortion
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Nearly two weeks after the Supreme Court overturned the constitutional right to abortion established by Roe v. Wade, South Carolina lawmakers became the first to consider more restrictive legislation.

title: Democrats Propose Raising Taxes on Some High Earners to Bolster Medicare
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats will push to raise taxes on some high-earning Americans and steer the money to improving the solvency of Medicare, according to officials briefed on the plan, as they cobble together a modest version of President Bidens stalled tax and spending package.

title: This Is America: Biden Honors 17 With Presidential Medal of Freedom
description: WASHINGTON  After conferring the Presidential Medal of Freedom on 17 people, including the gymnast Simone Biles and former Senator John McCain, who was honored posthumously, President Biden said, This is America.

title: The Delightful Implosion of Boris Johnson
description: There isnt much good news in the world these days, so its worth taking time to appreciate the delightful implosion of soon-to-be former Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

title: When Are Expired Drugs Truly Expired?
description: I dont know about your medicine cabinet, but mine is a jumble of mostly expired drugs: the muscle relaxants I got when I threw out my back a few years ago; the anti-nausea medicine I never took during my stomach woes last summer; the Xanax to occasionally help me cope with the dizzying state of the world.

title: 9 James Caan Movies to Stream
description: When James Caans family announced his death on Thursday, it sent shock waves through cinematic circles  not because his passing was particularly premature (he was 82), but because he seemed such a vibrant and outsize personality, you figured he just might live forever.

title: A Month of Shootings, One on Top of Another
description: In the U.S., a spate of gun violence in May, including two of the deadliest mass shootings so far this year, came at too fast a pace to grasp.

title: Secret Service Director to Step Down and Join Maker of Snapchat
description: WASHINGTON  The director of the Secret Service announced on Thursday that he would retire at the end of the month after a 27-year career with the agency that is charged with protecting the president of the United States.

title: Offering With a Blessing
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  For people first starting to solve crosswords, there is often a feeling of trepidation when they are confronted with a blank grid.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword
description: CRYPTIC CROSSWORD  Daily crossword solvers might recognize this puzzles constructor, Alan Arbesfeld, who has been making daily grids for The Times since 1981  131 in total, nearly all themed. This is his first variety puzzle and his first cryptic crossword. I love it: On one hand, there is something so mysterious and specialized about cryptics; theyre rare in the United States, and in their native stamping grounds of England their authors (or setters) often go by pseudonyms. On the other hand, what better source for a cryptic puzzle, full of puns and letter manipulation, than a mind thats come up with puzzle themes by the dozen and pun entries by the hundreds? I like to think that this puzzle is composed of outtakes and oddities from all of those years of hard work.

title: Man Who Swung Bat at Squeegee Workers in Baltimore Is Fatally Shot
description: A man who got out of his car and swung a bat at squeegee workers during a confrontation in downtown Baltimore was killed Thursday when one of the workers pulled out a gun and shot him, the authorities said.

title: The First Date That Lasted a Week
description: Charlie Kelly was so sure of a relationship with Jean Paul Broc Gomez that he began to think of ways to spend more time together before their first date officially got started.

title: A Compatible Phone Charger Led to a Strong Connection
description: When Amina Elise Colter walked into Barcelona Wine Bar 45 minutes late and sat down for her first date with Jason Michael Jones, he sensed that his waitress and nearby tables wanted to cheer. And so did he.

title: Losing the Pregnancy, the Marriage and the Pearls
description: My first job after college was as a seasonal sales associate at Macys in my hometown of Joplin, Mo. I had already worked there on two separate occasions before moving away for school. Now I was back, invariably ducking behind jewelry displays to avoid being spotted by old classmates.

title: A Bronx Tale of Persistence
description: Tara Cannistraci was finishing dinner with a friend at El Barrio in Scarsdale, N.Y., in early May 2017, when Michael Todd Mondrone, a part owner of the Mexican restaurant, sent over some sorbet as a way to introduce himself. She thanked me on her way out, Mr. Mondrone said. I asked her to stay.

title: Love, but Certainly Not at First Bite
description: When Madelyn Elizabeth Krebs and Tyler Christopher Fox met in August 2013, she was starting her second year at the North Carolina School of Science and Mathematics, a high school in Durham, and he was beginning his first.

title: A Fresh Start on the Mountain That Changed Her Life
description: Reggie Clark and Jamie MoCrazy were immediately drawn to each other after meeting through a mutual friend in June 2017 at a Bar Named Sue near Salt Lake City, where he lived. They bonded over a shared love for the outdoors.

title: At Europes Largest Port, Russia Sanctions Meet Their Toughest Test
description: ROTTERDAM, Netherlands  Jolanda Wielenga was checking documents accompanying containers bound for Russia when her heart skipped a beat: One held a substance that could be used to make a chemical weapon.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Boris Johnson, Britains beleaguered leader, said that he would step down as prime minister after a dizzying 48 hours that included a wholesale rebellion of his cabinet, a wave of government resignations and a devastating loss of party support prompted by his handling of the latest scandal to engulf his leadership.

title: Corrections: July 8, 2022
description: An article on Tuesday about widespread claims of 2020 election fraud on right-wing radio shows referred incorrectly to the Sinclair Broadcast Group as a syndicator of radio shows. The company does not syndicate radio shows.

title: Boris Johnson Was Just Being Boris Johnson
description: LONDON  Ive always resisted comparisons between Boris Johnson and Donald Trump. Not anymore.

title: The 3 Most Important Climate Laws Youve Never Heard Of
description: Good morning. Its Friday. Today well look at several low-profile yet important climate laws that Gov. Kathy Hochul signed into law this week. And well hear about a sense of dj vu as monkeypox spreads in the city, along with confusion over how to get the so-far scarce vaccine.

title: Videos Show the Moments After Shinzo Abe Is Shot
description: Footage shared on social media showed the scene after Shinzo Abe, the former prime minister of Japan, was assassinated while giving a speech in western Japan.

title: For foreign fighters, the war is unlike any theyve seen.
description: DRUZHKIVKA, Ukraine  Four months after Russia invaded Ukraine, foreign combat veterans who answered the Ukrainian presidents call to fight are grappling with the grueling reality of a war unlike any they have seen.

title: Divisions over the war play out at a G20 meeting as Russia prepares for an assault on Donetsk in eastern Ukraine.
description: As foreign ministers from the Group of 20 industrialized nations met in Bali on Friday to discuss some of the worlds most pressing challenges, including the war in Ukraine, the divisions playing out as a result of the fighting were to the fore diplomatically, too.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: FRIDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Dangerous Liaisons Review: The Epistolary Novel as Instagram Feed
description: First published in 1782, Pierre Choderlos de Lacloss wicked romp of a novel, Dangerous Liaisons, requires only a light airbrush to be convincingly transplanted to the halls of a modern-day high school where teenagers wield sex, power and status like weapons. Nevertheless, the director Rachel Suissa runs Lacloss story through a heavy Instagram filter in this outlandish, flimsy adaptation.

title: Johnsons Lies Worked for Years, Until They Didnt
description: After a lifetime of swaggering and dissembling his way through one scandal after another on the strength of his prodigious political skills  a potent mix of charm, guile, ruthlessness, hubris, oratorical dexterity and rumpled Wodehousian bluster  Boris Johnson has finally reached the end. It seems that the laws of gravity apply to him after all.

title: When Power Dressing Gets Personal
description: PARIS  Inclusivity, diversity, no gender binaries  he was the first one, said Olivier Rousteing, otherwise known as the creative director of Balmain, ticking off the issues at the forefront of identity politics.

title: Gun Violence Is Almost Nonexistent in Japan
description: The attack on former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan was especially shocking because it involved a gun  a type of crime that is extremely rare in a country with some of the most stringent laws around buying and owning a firearm.

title: What happens next for Brittney Griner?
description: By pleading guilty to drug charges in a Russian courtroom this week, the American basketball star Brittney Griner has potentially accelerated her cases conclusion, clearing a path for either a deal with the United States or, perhaps, a request for clemency.

title: Newly Published, From Banksy to Patrick Radden Keefe
description: BANKSY, by Stefano Antonelli and Gianluca Marziani. (Rizzoli Electa, $40.) This exhaustive collection showcases hundreds of works by the elusive street artist and global phenomenon, including famous paintings, serigraphs, stencils, installation objects and memorabilia.

title: The New York Times News Quiz, July 8, 2022
description: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: Be Careful Which Supplements You Take
description: A new F.D.A. education initiative suggests supplements can be more trouble than they are worth.

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
description: Selections from the Weekend section, including a review of "Thor: Love and Thunder."

title: Why We Need Bugs
What a New Supreme Court Review May Mean for Albanys Culture of Graft
description: Joseph Percoco and his taste for ziti. Alain Kaloyeros, the flashy tech executive convicted in a fraud. Joseph Bruno and a no-good racehorse named Christys Night Out.

title: How Could This Be Murder?
description: Ive enjoyed the recent miniboom in locked-room mysteries, though I am starting to wonder if the number of impossible crime plots are finite. (Ill add that any crime novel comparing itself to And Then There Were None or the film Knives Out must meet an exceedingly high threshold.)

title: Next Time Trump Tries to Steal an Election, He Wont Need a Mob
description: Last week, the Supreme Court announced it would hear arguments in Moore v. Harper, a challenge to North Carolinas new congressional map.

title: Democrats Can Win if They Embrace the Politics of Fear
description: When it comes to abortion rights, the Democrats need to lean into the politics of fear.

title: With Roe Overturned, Austins Loss Could Be Brooklyns Gain
description: Imagine that you are a young woman setting out on your adult life in the United States of America in 2022. College is behind you; fulfilling personal and professional ambitions in a stimulating place is meant to come next. Ten or 20 years ago, depending on your interests, you might have moved, as if by reflex, to New York or Chicago, to Los Angeles or San Francisco. But those cities have become only more punishingly expensive. The average rental price of an apartment in Brooklyn is now $3,500, up 12 percent over last year, when we were still lingering in the misguided belief that the pandemic had perhaps changed the city irrevocably toward the softer and more accessible. (In Manhattan, the figure jumped 32 percent to $4,800.)

title: Michelle Goldberg Grapples With Feminism After Roe
description: Its true: Were in trouble, writes Michelle Goldberg of the modern feminist movement. One thing backlashes do is transform a cultures common sense and horizons of possibility. A backlash isnt just a political formation. Its also a new structure of feeling that makes utopian social projects seem ridiculous.

title: How to Design a Beautiful, Cruel Universe
description: Most kids who play a lot of video games dont grow up to become avid readers. Then again, not every kid who reads a lot of books grows up to become an avid reader. Yet, in the diverse taxonomy of the modern gaming audience, there exists the Literary Gamer  someone for whom reading and playing are, and always have been, the same voyage. It would never occur to the Literary Gamer that one activity negates the other. If anything, the Literary Gamer believes, reading and playing enhance systematic thinking and the mysteries of imaginative empathy. This reviewer, for better or worse, is an avowed Literary Gamer  and I call upon my brothers and sisters to join me in a recitation of  Fnkes Axiom: There are dozens of us! DOZENS!

title: An Interview With San Franciscos New District Attorney
description: A month after San Francisco voters ousted their progressive district attorney, Chesa Boudin, the city has a new top cop.

title: Start-Up Equity Is a Great Retirement Plan, if You Can Pull It Off
description: Nearly two years ago, Trevor Ford left a job at LendingTree that gave him a 401(k) plan and a generous employer match to work at Yotta, an online banking app.

title: Before Heading to College, Make a Mental Health Checklist
description: As fall approaches, new students will arrive on college campuses toting all kinds of things: luggage and school supplies, mini fridges and sports equipment. But in the midst of the preparation for move-in day, many have not considered what tools they will need to support themselves emotionally.

title: Covering a Pre- and Post-Roe World
description: In July 2019, The Upshot, an arm of The New York Times that focuses on data-driven journalism, published the article Where Roe v. Wade Has the Biggest Effect. Written by the journalists Margot Sanger-Katz, Claire Cain Miller and Quoctrung Bui, the article examined what would happen if Roe v. Wade was to be overturned  Where would the number of legal abortions fall? What might happen in states with so-called trigger laws, which would ban abortion almost immediately? Using research, it estimated what could happen under various scenarios, and with maps, displayed what at that point was an alternate reality.

title: Codependency Is a Toxic Myth in Addiction Recovery
description: With over seven million copies sold, Melody Beatties 1986 best seller, Codependent No More: How to Stop Controlling Others and Start Caring for Yourself, is considered a self-help classic and continues to sell well in a new 2022 edition.

title: Rhea Seehorn Is Getting Away With It
description: LOS ANGELES  Rhea Seehorn insists she is a rule follower. And not the kind who, like her character Kim Wexler on AMCs Better Call Saul, follows some rules in public while bending others in secret to whatever ends she believes are just.

title: I Dont Want to See a High School Football Coach Praying at the 50-Yard Line
description: Many of us who believe in a reality beyond the visible realms, who believe in a soul that survives death, and who are hoping for seats in heaven near the dessert table, also recoil from the image of a high school football coach praying at the 50-yard line.

title: Whats Up With the Crazy Housing Market?
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: What Happens When a Rock Star Proposes Onstage?
description: It was something out of a fairy tale, if everyone in fairy tales wore denim and leather and looked like they smoked American Spirits. One minute, Olivia Jean was a shy kid from Michigan competing in her schools battle of the bands show, and the next, shes performing with her boyfriend, the musician Jack White, and hes proposing to her in the middle of his song Hotel Yorba  right before the line Lets get married/ In a big cathedral by a priest. A minute later, Mr. White remembered, come to think of it, one of the guys backstage was a licensed minister  does she want to get married right then?

title: How Dan Perlman, of Flatbush Misdemeanors, Spends His Sundays
description: The Showtime comedy Flatbush Misdemeanors was originally a low-budget web series created by Dan Perlman and Kevin Iso, two comics who had met at open mic events around the city. Now the show, about two friends struggling to get by in Flatbush, Brooklyn, is into its second season. Mr. Perlman, 32, who is also an executive producer of the series, lives in a one-bedroom apartment in, you guessed it, Flatbush.

title: Even in Death, Internet Explorer Lives On in South Korea
description: SEOUL  In South Korea, one of the worlds most technologically advanced countries, there are few limits to what can be done conveniently online  except if youre using the wrong web browser.

title: Windswept Views and Glories Strung Like Beads: Exploring Brooklyn by Ferry
description: Looking for a fresh way to scout Brooklyns waterfront? Try a ferry. For $2.75, you can explore ports of call that cradle a bounty of cultural and culinary adventures. Island-hopping from Manhattan can begin at the Pier 11-Wall Street landing, where the salty air is invigorating and anticipation builds as vessels with names like Ferry Godmother, City Fishy and McShiny pull in to whisk you away.

title: The Robot Guerrilla Campaign to Recreate the Elgin Marbles
description: Few cultural disputes inflame British passions more than the disposition of the Parthenon Marbles. Public debate about the statuary has raged since the early 1800s, when the sculptures and bas-reliefs, which date from 447 B.C. to 432 B.C., were stripped from the Parthenon and other Classical Greek temples on the Acropolis of Athens by agents of Thomas Bruce, a Scottish statesman and seventh earl of Elgin. The marbles were purchased  some say looted  by Elgin during his time as ambassador to the Ottoman Empire, the occupying power; they have resided in the British Museum since 1817.

title: Shinzo Abe Is Assassinated With a Handmade Gun, Shocking a Nation
description: TOKYO  Shinzo Abe, Japans most influential former prime minister, was stumping on behalf of a junior politician from his party near a train station in Japans old capital city of Nara on Friday morning when he collapsed, bleeding, on the street. He was shot in the neck, doctors said, by a gunman who later admitted he had come to kill him.

title: Shinzo Abe, Japans Longest-Serving Prime Minister, Dies at 67
description: Shinzo Abe, the longest-serving Japanese prime minister, who made it his political mission to vanquish his countrys wartime ghosts but fell short of his ultimate goal of restoring Japan as a normalized military power, was assassinated on Friday in the city of Nara, Japan. He was 67.

title: Sepp Blatter and Michel Platini Acquitted of Fraud
description: Sepp Blatter, the former president of FIFA, and his onetime ally Michel Platini were acquitted of fraud on Friday in the latest attempt by Swiss prosecutors to win a conviction in a sprawling, seven-year investigation into corruption at the highest levels of world soccer.

title: These 8 measures reflect a slowing U.S. economy.
description: The American economy is showing clear signs of slowing down, fueling concerns about a potential recession.

title: U.S. Economy Added 372,000 Jobs in June, Defying Slowdown Fears
description: The U.S. economy powered through June with broad-based hiring on par with recent months, keeping the country clear of recession territory even as inflation eats into wages and interest rates continue to rise.

title: Quotation of the Day: He Charms, Lies and Blusters: It Always Saved Him, Till Now
description: People have known that Boris Johnson lies for 30 years. Hes probably the best liar weve ever had as a prime minister. He knows a hundred different ways to lie.

title: The Final Days of Boris Johnson
description: After a flurry of ministerial resignations and calls from members of his own party for his departure, Boris Johnson agreed on Thursday to resign as prime minister of Britain.

title: Families of civilian soldiers worry and wait in Ukraine.
description: LVIV, Ukraine  As thousands of young men and women are deployed to the front lines in Ukraine, each leaves behind family members and friends who hold their collective breath.

title: Twitter is ready for a legal battle to force Elon Musk to buy the company.
description: [Follow for updates as Elon Musk has said he plans to terminate his $44 billion deal to buy Twitter.]

title: Everyday Violence
description: Since a gunman killed seven people at a Chicago suburbs July 4 parade, more than 160 people have died from other gun homicides across the country. In Chicago alone, at least 10 people were killed in multiple shootings during the holiday weekend.

title: U.S. Qualifies for 2023 Womens World Cup
description: A United States womens national team that arrived in Mexico this week with two objectives has already achieved the first: After a lopsided victory over Jamaica on Thursday night, the United States clinched a place in the 2023 Womens World Cup.

title: Under Pressure, Biden Issues Executive Order on Abortion
description: WASHINGTON  Under pressure to do more to respond to the Supreme Courts decision to overturn Roe v. Wade, President Biden issued an executive order on Friday designed to ensure access to abortion medication and emergency contraception while preparing for legal fights to come.

title: Being Marina Abramovi, Even When No Ones Looking
description: The New York-based artist Marina Abramovi is sitting in the kitchen of her house just outside of Hudson when she invites me  over FaceTime  to join her in Greece this August for a workshop organized by the Marina Abramovi Institute (MAI). Its only five days. No food, no talking and heavy exercise, says the artist, 75, with a chuckle. Abramovi founded the institute in 2007, originally intending to convert a derelict theater built sometime around the 1930s nearby into a top-of-the-line Rem Koolhaas-designed performance space, archive and education center. But when the projects budget ballooned out of her control (Koolhaass plans alone were estimated to be $31 million, which didnt include the handling of the theaters pre-existing asbestos problem) and her fund-raising efforts fell short (a Kickstarter only got her to a little over half a million dollars), Abramovi decided to turn it into something that didnt depend on a physical location. Its new slogan? Dont come to us; we come to you.

title: Biodiversity Crisis Affects Billions Who Rely on Wild Species, Researchers Say
description: Billions of people worldwide rely on some 50,000 wild species for food, energy, medicine and income, according to a sweeping new scientific report that concluded humans must make dramatic changes to hunting and other practices to address an accelerating biodiversity crisis.

title: Assassination Rattles Peaceful Japan
description: The stunning assassination of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe rattled Japan and its sense of identity as a peaceful country where violent crime is rare.

title: This Week in Extreme Weather
description: A deadly glacier collapse in Italy, Jello-green skies over South Dakota and a warning about Europe's hot future.

title: The Historically Black College Reconsiders the Studio Art Program
description: The fourth edition of H. W. Jansons History of Art, long the standard introductory text in art history courses, is over 850 pages long, with more than 1,000 illustrations, weighing in at over seven and a half pounds. It aims for the encyclopedic, from cave paintings of the Old Stone Age to the latest video art. During the fall of 1992, when the artist Derek Fordjour was 18 years old, he lugged the book to class at Pratt Institute in Brooklyn with earnest intentions of pursuing an artistic career. The child of Ghanaian immigrants who had made a home in Memphis, Fordjour had absorbed his parents work ethic and respect for education. But something was missing for him in that hefty tome: nearly the entire history of Black art in America.

title: Waiting for a Slowdown
description: This morning, the Labor Department  reported that employers added 372,000 workers to their payrolls in June. Economists were expecting hiring to have slowed last month, as fewer workers are available or willing to take open jobs, and while consumer spending is slowing as higher interest rates, imposed by the Fed to combat inflation, take their toll.

title: Boris Johnson Hasnt Left, but the Jockeying to Replace Him Has Begun
description: LONDON  On the surface, it looked like business as usual at the heart of British government on Friday, a day after Boris Johnson was forced to announce he would resign as prime minister when his party turned against him over the latest in a series of embarrassing scandals.

title: Jos Eduardo dos Santos, Longtime Angolan Ruler, Dies at 79
description: Jos Eduardo dos Santos, a onetime Soviet-trained fighter against Portuguese colonial rule who in nearly four decades as Angolas president became one of Africas longest-serving rulers  and was also accused of corruption on a grand scale  died on Friday in Barcelona, Spain, where he had been living in self-imposed exile. He was 79.

title: Wages climbed 5.1 percent, a still-rapid pace as Fed awaits slowdown.
description: Wages continued to climb rapidly last month, offering little encouragement to the Federal Reserve as policymakers hope for a slowdown in pay gains that might allow inflation to moderate.

title: What to Know About Rolling Over Retirement Accounts
description: Americans who are moving money from a workplace retirement plan to an individual retirement account may be tripped up by seemingly modest increases in fees that can significantly erode savings over time, new research has found.

title: Summer Reading Contest, Week 5: What Got Your Attention in The Times This Week?
description: Update, July 26: The Week 5 winners have been announced!

title: Their Wildest Dreams
description: One summer, when I was a single mother raising my second and fourth graders in Brooklyn and the weeks ahead without child care loomed large, my friend Catherine and I rented a farmhouse in upstate New York for a month. She brought her 9-year-old twins, and we let the kids explore the woods while we worked. We gave them a loud whistle and generous boundaries  the distant stone wall, the serpentine stream, the neighboring field  and sent them off to run wild.

title: Can a Friendship Offer Redemption?: The Week in Narrated Articles
description: This weekend, listen to a collection of narrated articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.

title: Zawe Ashton Isnt Here to Be a Victim of Your Projections
description: I havent necessarily had the privilege of being cast as the hero, Zawe Ashton said. And thats OK.

title: A Self-Taught Artist Takes His Roadside Acropolis North
description: HAMMOND, La.  Along Interstate 55 heading to this small town north of New Orleans, you pass several signs telling you whats ahead, literally and maybe also metaphorically: Ponchatoula Antique City, Tickfaw State Park, Dons Seafood, Apocalypse Sports (Guns, Ammo, Tactical.)

title: He Had a Dark Secret. It Changed His Best Friends Life.
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Network Disruption Triggers Internet and Phone Outages in Canada
description: TORONTO  An outage on Friday at Rogers, one of Canadas largest telecommunications companies, caused significant internet, cable and cellphone disruptions, mostly in Ontario and Quebec, the countrys most populous provinces.

title: Russia sentences a lawmaker to seven years in prison for denouncing the war.
description: A court in Moscow on Friday sentenced an opposition lawmaker to seven years in prison for denouncing Russias war in Ukraine, handing down the first prison term for what the government made a crime shortly after the invasion.

title: Start Investing Early and Stick With It, Especially When Stocks Fall
description: I wouldnt wish this bear market on anyone.

title: An improvised firearm was used to assassinate Abe.
description: The weapon used to assassinate former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan was an improvised firearm.

title: BA.4 and BA.5 power a surge of known infections in Europe, officials say.
description: The rapidly spreading Omicron subvariants known as BA.4 and BA.5 are driving a summertime surge of the coronavirus in Europe, health officials say, after most Covid policies were removed in spring and a more relaxed approach to the pandemic has become the norm during the warmer months.

title: Emmy Rossum Dreams of Pink Macarons
description: Look, Emmy Rossum said, squeezing an excess of rose buttercream onto a waiting meringue. We cant all be perfect the first time.

title: High Court Sides With Prince Harry in Libel Claim
description: LONDON  A judge in Britain ruled on Friday that parts of an article in a tabloid newspaper about Prince Harrys fight with the government over police protection were defamatory, in an initial phase of Harrys libel case against the paper.

title: The power, and limits, of local action
description: The White House cant get climate legislation passed. Congress is gridlocked. The Supreme Court has tied the hands of the federal agency entrusted to protect the environment.

title: Three Tales From the Transfer Market
description: Lets try something different in this weeks newsletter: A journey through modern soccer in three (vaguely related) stories.

title: Kenward Elmslie, Poet and Librettist, Dies at 93
description: Kenward Elmslie, who wrote poetry, opera librettos and stage musicals, and who late in life made headlines when his chauffeur bilked him out of millions of dollars and several valuable artworks, including one by Andy Warhol, died on June 29 at his home in the West Village. He was 93.

title: Five Science Fiction Movies to Stream Now
description: Time travel and romance make for a good cinematic combination because we just want to believe that true love is out there, even if you need a temporal do-over or three to finally secure it. In Greg Bjrkmans assured debut feature, Laura (Clara Rugaard, from I Am Mother) and Harrison (Lewis Pullman, Top Gun: Maverick) meet, argue about the band Japanese Breakfast and fall in love. Then a car hits him and he dies.

title: Wisconsin Supreme Court Prohibits the Use of Most Drop Boxes for Voting
description: The Wisconsin Supreme Court on Friday prohibited the use of most drop boxes for voters returning absentee ballots, giving the states Republicans a major victory in their efforts to limit voting access in urban areas.

title: Shinzo Abe tried to move Japan beyond postwar remorse and pacifism.
description: Shinzo Abe, the longest-serving Japanese prime minister, who made it his political mission to vanquish his countrys wartime ghosts but fell short of his goal of restoring Japan as a normalized military power, was assassinated on Friday in the city of Nara, Japan. He was 67.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. Bryan Washington is in The New York Times Magazine this weekend with a lovely paean to biscuits, along with a terrific new recipe for kimchi-Cheddar biscuits (above) that would make for a lovely late breakfast tomorrow, with some eggs and sausage if you eat such things.

title: Private-sector employment has recovered to prepandemic levels.
description: Job growth in June was driven by industries recuperating from pandemic-induced losses, and continued business investment in sectors still benefiting from formidable demand for their goods and services, even as borrowing costs increase.

title: Strong Wage and Jobs Growth Keeps Fed on Track for Big Rate Increase
description: A surprisingly robust June employment report reinforced that Americas labor market remains historically strong even as recession warnings reach a fever pitch. But that development, while good news for the Biden administration, is likely to keep the Federal Reserve on its aggressive path of interest rate increases as it tries to cool the economy and slow inflation.

title: The attack scrambled campaign plans two days before Japans election.
description: TOKYO  It was supposed to be a quiet election for the Upper House of Parliament. But the assassination on Friday of Japans longest-serving prime minister, Shinzo Abe, has added an element of chaos to Japanese politics just two days before voters head to the ballot box.

title: Assassination Shocks a Nearly Gun-Free Japan
description: The assassination of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe during a campaign rally in western Japan was especially hard to fathom because it involved a gun  a type of crime that is extremely rare in a country with some of the most stringent laws on buying and owning firearms.

title: The 1975s Chamber-Pop Confessions, and 8 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: Whats Next for Abortion Rights in New York?
description: New York has long been at the forefront of the push for abortion access. The state legalized the procedure three years before the Supreme Court decided Roe v. Wade in 1973. Thousands of women flooded in from other states, soon outnumbering the number of New York residents getting abortions.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Michelle Goldberg
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Michelle Goldberg. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: In The Bear on Hulu, a Kitchen Staff Is Nearly Eaten Alive
description: Movies and TV shows about the inner workings of the culinary world have let us peek into restaurant kitchens before. But FXs new The Bear is the first to force you to work in one.

title: At the Opera, Humans Bear Witness to Atrocity, or Ignore It
description: AIX-EN-PROVENCE, France  The bodies kept coming up.

title: Clergys Call for an Assault Weapons Ban
description: To the Editor:

title: Trigger Point Review: Pure Pressure  la Line of Duty
description: There are two kinds of people in the world: those who havent seen or heard of the British cop show Line of Duty and those who are rabid fans of it. It isnt a great television series, or even a very good one, necessarily. But it has a loony, breathless intensity that sucks you in and a willingness to toy with its regular characters emotions, and question their motives, that is dramatically suspect but melodramatically potent. Through six seasons, it remains one of Britains most popular and honored TV shows.

title: Hes the N.H.L.s Next Big Star. He Just Has to Wait a Year.
description: MONTREAL  Elite teenage hockey players wearing suits, ties and anxious looks were sitting in the stands at Bell Centre and waiting for their names to be called at the N.H.L. draft Thursday night. In a departure from most drafts, no prospect had established himself as the best in his year and rumors and speculation swirled. The last time there had been any real suspense around the first overall pick dated back to the wooden-stick era.

title: 6 New Paperbacks to Check Out This Week
description: These titles by Sally Rooney, Matt Bell, and more offer a variety of genres and narratives for any reader.

title: Director of the Guggenheim to Step Down
description: Richard Armstrong, the director of the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, said he planned to retire from his role next year, capping off more than 14 years leading the institution and its international offshoots.

title: A Sheet-Pan Chicken Recipe for Lovers of Sweet and Savory
description: Every July, I question my sour cherry priorities. Their season is so short, and the fruit so scarce that I rarely get around to making anything beyond one big, gushy pie and a years supply of homemade maraschino cherries (must-haves in my manhattan cocktail).

title: Why Is Everyone Wearing Suits?: #GentleMinions Has Moviegoers Dressing Up
description: Normally when Carson Paskill heads to the movie theater, he opts for a comfortable outfit of sweatpants and a sweatshirt. But last weekend, he arrived in a black suit, white collared shirt and dress shoes.

title: Larry Storch, Comic Actor Best Known for F Troop, Dies at 99
description: Larry Storch, who played a memorable television oddball on the 1960s sitcom F Troop and for years carried a secret in his personal life that was odd in an entirely different way, died on Friday at his home on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. He was 99.

title: The Weekender
description: A 2,700-mile cycling race is now even more extreme. Also in this edition: exploring Brooklyn by ferry, and a campaign to recreate the Elgin marbles.

title: For Ukraine, Boris Johnsons Resignation Means Loss of a Personal Ally
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Boris Johnson may be a polarizing figure in Britain, where his long association with scandal rendered him a lonely man this week as scores of onetime political allies abandoned him, forcing his resignation.

title: Biden Praises Strong Jobs Report
description: The report suggests that the United States was not in recession, but points to ongoing challenges with inflation.

title: Grime Transformed British Music. A New Exhibition Traces How.
description: LONDON  On a wall-mounted screen at the Museum of London, a low-resolution video showed young people rapping quickly and hungrily over syncopated beats. Every so often, a decidedly 2000s graphic flashed on the screen, reading Risky Roadz 2.

title: Glimpses of Brittney Griner Show a Complicated Path to Release
description: One hundred forty-one days.

title: Joyce C. Lashof, Doctor Who Shattered Glass Ceilings, Dies at 96
description: Dr. Joyce C. Lashof, who fought for health equity and broke barriers as the first woman to head a state public health department and the first to serve as dean of the School of Public Health at the University of California, Berkeley, died on June 4 at an assisted living community in Berkeley. She was 96.

title: A One-Hour Layover Is Not Enough Anymore: A Flight Attendants Tips on Surviving Travel Now
description: Twenty years ago, with my life at a serious crossroads, I applied to every single airline, and a few months later I was officially a flight attendant. I loved my new job, and it came with a completely new and exciting life.

title: Russias Lavrov Is Pariah at Group of 20 Event, but Only for Some
description: NUSA DUA, Indonesia  He was like a skunk at the tropical resort party, shunned by many, though by no means all.

title: Novak Djokovic vs. Nick Kyrgios Makes for a Villainous Wimbledon Final
description: WIMBLEDON, England  In the last year, Novak Djokovic has experienced the highest of tennis highs, coming within one match of winning a rare calendar-year Grand Slam and the lowest of lows, including detainment and deportation after he arrived in Melbourne in January to try to defend his Australian Open title.

title: Love Letter: The Pearls Shell Never Wear
description: Eliza Smith was only 18 when she found herself back with her ex-boyfriend and, then, unintentionally pregnant.

title: He Presented Another Path: Actors and Directors on Peter Brook
description: The actor Kathryn Hunter heard the news of the director Peter Brooks death, last weekend at 97, in a telephone call from his longtime collaborator Marie-Hlne Estienne. Then Hunter, an Olivier Award winner who played the witches in Joel Coens film The Tragedy of Macbeth, set off across London for Shakespeares Globe.

title: At Ballet Theater, Visions of the Natural World and Swan Debuts
description: American Ballet Theaters Swan Lake, which wrapped up its performances at the Metropolitan Opera House on Wednesday, can feel choppy, as if its swans were pushing through water that becomes rougher with each passing year. This production, from 2000, was staged by Kevin McKenzie, who will soon retire as Ballet Theaters artistic director. Is it time for his Swan Lake to leave the company, too? Alexei Ratmansky, the artist in residence, has a jewel of a Swan Lake in his back pocket, already made.

title: You Cant Outrun Athletic Greens
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: The U.S. will send another $400 million in military supplies to Ukraine, an official says.
description: A senior defense official said Friday that President Biden had authorized up to $400 million in additional military supplies  including precision-guided shells and multiple rocket launchers  to be taken from Pentagon stockpiles and shipped to Ukraine.

title: Looking for Aces Guard Jackie Young? Shes Probably in the Gym.
description: Las Vegas Aces guard Jackie Young has met success at every level of basketball. She has a high school championship, an N.C.A.A. Division I title at Notre Dame, and last summer, she claimed Olympic gold in the first 3x3 competition. Now, as a first-time W.N.B.A. All-Star, Young, an Indiana native, has added another accolade en route to her ultimate goal.

title: Wonking Out: Rockets, Feathers and Prices at the Pump
description: One of the sad paradoxes of politics is that few economic indicators matter more for public opinion  for voters evaluation of the government in power  than energy prices, especially the price of gasoline. This isnt just a U.S. phenomenon: Inflation driven by soaring energy prices has undermined the popularity of leaders across the Western world.

title: Three Memoirs That Re-examine Challenges in Life and Identity
description: On the cover of Cindy Houses new memoir, MOTHER NOISE (Marysue Rucci Books/Scribner, 266 pp., $26.99), a neon-tinged spoon next to spilled milk and colorful cereal artfully hints at the authors twin themes: drug abuse and motherhood.

title: Review: Momixs Alice Is a Rabbit Hole (or 22) Too Far
description: The dance critic Edwin Denby once wrote, Daily life is wonderfully full of things to see. That observation came to mind on Thursday during Momixs Alice, a banal and busy 85-minute spectacle now at the Joyce Theater. Not that anything particularly wondrous was going on; quite the opposite. At that point in the show, the thought of simply stepping outdoors into the city night  to look at traffic, or the sunset, or people in the streets  was more enticing than any fantasy depicted onstage.

title: The U.S. May Be Losing the Fight Against Monkeypox, Scientists Say
description: As epidemics go, the monkeypox outbreak should have been relatively easy to snuff out. The virus does not spread efficiently except through intimate contact, and tests and vaccines were at hand even before the current outbreak.

title: Uniper, Germanys largest gas importer, asks for government bailout.
description: As Europes energy crisis escalates, Uniper, Germanys largest importer of natural gas, asked the government for help on Friday, hours after Parliament passed a law aimed at keeping the energy provider afloat.

title: Biden Signs Executive Order to Protect Abortion Access
description: President Biden issued an order aiming to protect access to abortion medication and emergency contraception, but details on how those goals would be accomplished were not outlined.

title: There is no sign of a Russian pause for one Ukrainian town under fire.
description: BAKHMUT, Ukraine  Russias defense ministry has said that it is conducting an operational pause in the war in Ukraine to allow units that have been fighting to rest, prompting military analysts to suggest that Russia was not ready to press into a full assault within Donetsk Province after its capture of neighboring Luhansk.

title: Where Bobbleheads Are Born
description: At 10:30 a.m. on the second day of the annual Licensing Expo in Las Vegas, mascots from a wide variety of beloved brands lined up by a small stage in the back of the convention center at the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino, preparing to march around for a character parade. Sonic the Hedgehog was there, as were several Teletubbies, a Smurf, Peppa Pig, the Elf on the Shelf and Geoffrey, the Toys R Us giraffe. Also in attendance: a Dole pineapple with huge eyes and supple pink lips, and a Dole banana who looked very happy, but lacked the pout of its pineapple friend.

title: Boris Johnson Leaves a Mixed Legacy With His Brexit Gambit
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson will be remembered for Britains exit from the European Union long after the world has forgotten the tousled hair, the quotations in Homeric Greek, the fibs, fabrications and scandals  not to mention the time he got stuck on a zip line while serving as London mayor, sheepishly waving Union Jacks.

title: Despite a Wimbledon Ban on Russian Players, a Russian Woman Might Win
description: WIMBLEDON, England  After all the debate over whether to bar Russian and Belarusian players from Wimbledon, and under pressure from the British government, the womens singles title may be won on Saturday by a player born in Russia after all.

title: The Far-Right Christian Quest for Power: We Are Seeing Them Emboldened
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: From Sad Leftovers to Dream Dinners
description: This is Priya Krishna, your replacement captain for this weeks Five Weeknight Dishes. The Priya you see today has come a long way in the kitchen. My young, new-to-New York self had a simple but cost-effective weeknight cooking strategy: Buy the same few ingredients every week (pasta, spinach, tomatoes, feta, frozen dumplings, sausage, yogurt), throw a surprise item (sweet potatoes! cookie butter ice cream! an avocado!) into the cart, and make it all work with the rest of my pantry.

title: Review Finds Agents Used Unnecessary Force Against Black Migrants
description: WASHINGTON  Border Patrol agents on horseback used unnecessary force in September against Black migrants who crossed into Del Rio, Texas, en masse, amid a humanitarian crisis that exposed the Biden administrations struggle to manage a record number of southwestern border crossings.

title: Putting the Public Back in Public Service
description: WASHINGTON  One of the most vexing questions about the dysfunction of Congress is why lawmakers cannot find common ground on big issues facing the country when convincing data suggests there is broad public consensus about what should be done.

title: The Chain of Failures That Left 17 Dead in a Bronx Apartment Fire
description: A Times investigation shows how a New York City high-rise became a deadly chimney of smoke.

title: Why the Overturning of Roe Wont Lead to a Return of Segregation
description: Now that the Supreme Court, with its ruling in Dobbs v. Jackson Womens Health Organization, has struck down Roe v. Wade, many have argued that the court might begin diminishing or doing away with other expansions of constitutional rights. Much of the reaction traces to Justice Clarence Thomas, who in his concurring opinion in Dobbs argued that In future cases, we should reconsider all of this Courts substantive due process precedents, including Griswold, Lawrence and Obergefell. It was a shot across the legal bow that prompted James Obergefell, one of the petitioners in Obergefell v. Hodges  the case that guaranteed same-sex couples a constitutional right to marry  to respond, in an interview on CNN last week, that Thomas had put a target on the right to contraception, the right to intimacy with the person you love and the right to marry the person you love, and that should terrify everyone in this nation.

title: Losing the fight against monkeypox
description: The monkeypox outbreak should have been relatively easy to snuff out. The virus does not spread efficiently except through intimate contact, and tests and vaccines were at hand before the current outbreak.

title: Divided Ukrainians
description: Hello. This is your Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, a weeknight guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: Air Pollution Kills 10 Million People a Year. Why Do We Accept That as Normal?
description: For every thousand people alive on earth, 973 are regularly inhaling toxins. Only 27 are not. Which means, almost certainly, you are too.

title: A Special Edition: Shinzo Abe Assassinated
description: A gunman shot Shinzo Abe, Japans most influential former prime minister, while he was giving a speech at a campaign event in the city of Nara. Less than six hours later, Abe, the longest-serving leader in Japans postwar history, was dead at age 67.

title: How Can I Dress to Not Look Like a Tourist in France?
description: Once upon a time it was easy to spot Americans abroad (or so the clich went, anyway): They were the loud ones in jeans and T-shirts with fanny packs and baseball caps.

title: The Mayor Who Never Sleeps
description: On a breezy June night in the Bronx, I was on the balcony at the restaurant Zona De Cuba, sipping a mojito, vibing to a salsa band and peeking at a special menu for the plant-based mayor of New York, Eric Adams, who was soon to arrive.

title: Elon Musk Moves to End $44 Billion Deal to Buy Twitter
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Less than three months ago, Elon Musk, the worlds richest man, struck a blockbuster $44 billion deal to buy Twitter. He proclaimed that the company had tremendous potential.

title: Russia Votes to Shut Down Last U.N. Aid Route Into Syria
description: WASHINGTON  Russia vetoed a measure on Friday that would have allowed the last U.N. aid route into Syria to remain open for another year, in a vote that diplomats and critics said endangered the lives of millions of people already suffering after more than a decade of war.

title: 911 Dispatcher Faces Manslaughter Charge After Failing to Send Ambulance
description: A 911 dispatcher has been charged with involuntary manslaughter after he failed to send an ambulance to a woman in rural Pennsylvania who was bleeding and incoherent and who died a day later, the authorities said.

title: Remembering James Caan and His Potent Mix of Swagger and Delicacy
description: Im not sure who owned the book, but eventually it ended up in my sweaty young hands. Someone at school had told me about the scene in Mario Puzos The Godfather, the one in which Sonny Corleone, the reckless eldest son with a Cupid face and a massive endowment, steals off with one of his sisters bridesmaids. I remember racing through the passage (her legs were wrapped around his thighs). Its no wonder that when I saw Francis Ford Coppolas film, I was more than ready for James Caan.

title: Columbia Loses Its No. 2 Spot in the U.S. News Rankings
description: What is the equivalent of disbarred or defrocked in the world of college rankings?

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: What the Biden Administration Could Do Now to Protect Abortion Rights
description: Barely two weeks have passed since the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, and already chaos reigns. Several states are moving to ban abortion almost completely, abortion-rights proponents are challenging those bans in court and in some cases, judges have been asked to issue injunctions that could, for a time, prevent the bans from going into effect.

title: For Sundays Wimbledon Final, Fireworks and a Contrast in Style
description: WIMBLEDON, England  With the Wimbledon title at stake, it will be the maximizer versus the man who seemingly makes it up as he goes along.

title: Can Lisa Murkowski Fend Off Kelly Tshibaka in Alaska?
description: Paulette Schuerch, a Native Alaskan who helped Lisa Murkowskis fabled write-in campaign for Senate in 2010, is now working for the senators Trump-backed opponent, Kelly Tshibaka.

title: As Russia Looms, a Ukrainian Citys Loyalties Divide
description: SLOVIANSK, Ukraine  A woman berated visiting reporters, accusing them of publishing lies. Others turned away, reluctant to talk. Tensions were running high in the central market of Sloviansk, after rocket strikes earlier this week killed seven people and destroyed shops and houses.

title: Louisiana Judge Allows Abortion Ban to Take Effect
description: A judge in Louisiana allowed state laws banning nearly all abortions to take effect on Friday, lifting an earlier court decision that had temporarily blocked them.

title: At BroadwayCon, Hillary Clinton Celebrates Women in the Theater
description: Theres a lot to worry about right now in our country and the world, Hillary Clinton, the former secretary of state, told a packed room of about 500 people gathered at the grand ballroom at the Manhattan Center on Friday afternoon. And I think we need theater and the arts more than ever.

title: Adams Shows Support for Man Charged in Bodega Killing That Caused Outcry
description: The chaotic scene inside a Harlem bodega began with a bag of chips and a declined electronic card transaction. It ended in death.

title: Susie Steiner, Author of Acclaimed British Crime Novels, Dies at 51
description: Susie Steiner, the author of the critically acclaimed Manon Bradshaw detective novels, who was declared legally blind from a rare disease months before she sold her first book, died on July 2 in London. She was 51.

title: Shinzo Abes Influence Was Still Evident Long After He Left Office
description: WASHINGTON  In his record-breaking run as prime minister, Shinzo Abe never achieved his goal of revising Japans Constitution to transform his country into what the Japanese call a normal nation, able to employ its military to back up its national interests like any other.

title: Denali National Park, in Alaska, reinstates an indoor mask mandate in the busy summer season.
description: With coronavirus cases increasing in its immediate vicinity in Alaska, the vast Denali National Park and Preserve reimposed a mask mandate on Friday for federal buildings and on park buses.

title: Tony Sirico, an Eccentric Gangster on The Sopranos, Dies at 79
description: Tony Sirico, the actor best known for playing the eccentric gangster Paulie Walnuts on the hit HBO series The Sopranos, died on Friday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 79.

title: Alice Elliott Dark on Fellowship Point
description: In Alice Elliott Darks second novel, Fellowship Point, Agnes Lee and Polly Wister have been friends for about 80 years. Their intertwined families own homes on a Maine peninsula, and some of the books drama stems from their efforts to preserve the land and keep it out of the hands of developers.

title: Illustrious
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  I think this is the hardest Saturday grid we have seen in some months, but its been years since Kevin G. Ders last solo Saturday puzzle, published back in 2018. Note the quadruple stacks, technical feats of construction, in this grids northeast and southwest corners. Also note the torrent of debuts  11 in a 66-word puzzle  as well as a big bunch of oddities.

title: Just Months After the Last Floods, Its the Same Thing Again
description: Every time its flooded its gotten higher and higher, said April Harley, 38, a resident of Camden who has experienced four floods in the last four months. Its scary.

title: A shocking crime with many unanswered questions.
description: As Japans former prime minister, Shinzo Abe, spoke to the crowd in the city of Nara, a man in cargo pants and a grey shirt approached from behind, carrying a crude handmade gun. He shot Mr. Abe twice.

title: Biden Administration Signals Support for Controversial Alaska Oil Project
description: WASHINGTON  The Biden administration took a key step toward approving a huge oil drilling project in the North Slope of Alaska, angering environmental activists who said allowing it to go forward would make a mockery of President Bidens climate-change promise to end new oil leases.

title: The assassination shocked a nearly gun-free Japan.
description: The assassination of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe during a campaign rally in western Japan was especially hard to fathom because it involved a gun  a type of crime that is extremely rare in a country with some of the most stringent laws on buying and owning firearms.

title: Judge and Stanton Will Start for A.L. in All-Star Game
description: The Yankees will have two-thirds of the American Leagues starting outfield in this years All-Star Game, with Aaron Judge and Giancarlo Stanton taking the corner spots on either side of Mike Trout of the Los Angeles Angels.

title: Its Like Parallel Realities: Rituals of Life and Death Blur in a Vibrant Ukrainian City
description: LVIV, Ukraine  The tiny wail of newborn babies echoes out from the incubators and cribs lining a small room with mint green walls in a maternity hospital in Lviv.

title: Quotation of the Day: Single Moms Cant Get Aid From Beijing
description: If you really want to have a baby without a man you have to fight for it.

title: Corrections: July 9, 2022
description: Because of an editing error, an article on Wednesday about areas of eastern Ukraine that Russias invasion has left largely devoid of people and industry misstated the location of the conference where Ukraines prime minister, Denys Shmyhal, described the cost of rebuilding his country. It was in Switzerland, not Italy.

title: Questions Arise About Abes Security Protection After Assassination
description: A day after former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was gunned down in broad daylight, a stunned nation is questioning how the gunman was able to approach one of Japans most prominent politicians and fire two shots from close range without security stepping in.

title: Aboard a Hot Dog Bus in Hong Kong
description: Hot dog buses, nicknamed for their lack of air-conditioning, have not picked up passengers in Hong Kong for 10 years.  Join me for a ride on one.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SATURDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Dressing Your Home for Success
description: Even in todays red-hot market, where buyers are fighting tooth and nail for a limited supply of homes, how a property looks  in listing photos and in person  is important. This is where staging comes in. It doesnt matter whether its a sellers market or a buyers market, says Monica P. Murphy, the owner of Preferred Staging, a home staging company in Potomac Falls, Va. What staging does is it makes your home more presentable.

title: Companies Climate Promises Face a Wild Card: Farmers
description: Driving rain pelted the windows of the Tower, a second-story glass enclosure in Ray Gaessers home that provides a view for miles of the gentle, rolling fields around Corning, Iowa. Inside, away from the elements, Mr. Gaesser pondered what the coming year might bring for farmers.

title: With Sign Language and Sound, an Artist Upends Audience Perceptions
description: Last summer, a small plane hauled a sign with an intriguing phrase over Manchester, England: The Sound of Smiling.

title: The Postwar Japan That Shinzo Abe Built
description: In January 2007, only a few months after he was elected, at 52, as Japans youngest prime minister of the postwar era, Shinzo Abe delivered a speech outlining his policy priorities after the opening ceremony of the 166th session of Japans Diet, the countrys parliamentary body.

title: Abe was a transformational figure in Japan.
